poem.verse: 1How happy is the one who does not

poetryblock.poem: walk in the advice of the wicked
or stand in the pathway with sinners
or sit in the company of mockers!

poem.verse: 2Instead, his delight is in the Lord’s instruction,

poetryblock.poem: and he meditates on it day and night.

poem.verse: 3He is like a tree planted beside flowing streams

poetryblock.poem: that bears its fruit in its season,
and its leaf does not wither.
Whatever he does prospers.

poem.verse: 4The wicked are not like this;

poetryblock.poem: instead, they are like chaff that the wind blows away.

poem.verse: 5Therefore the wicked will not stand up in the judgement,

poetryblock.poem: nor sinners in the assembly of the righteous.

poem.verse: 6For the Lord watches over the way of the righteous,

poetryblock.poem: but the way of the wicked leads to ruin.

poem.verse: 1Why do the nations rage

poetryblock.poem: and the peoples plot in vain?

poem.verse: 2The kings of the earth take their stand,

poetryblock.poem: and the rulers conspire together
against the Lord and his Anointed One:

poem.verse: 3‘Let’s tear off their chains

poetryblock.poem: and throw off their ropes.’

poem.verse: 4The one enthroned in heaven laughs;

poetryblock.poem: the Lord ridicules them.

poem.verse: 5Then he speaks to them in his anger

poetryblock.poem: and terrifies them in his wrath:

poem.verse: 6‘I have installed my king

poetryblock.poem: on Zion, my holy mountain.’

poem.verse: 7I will declare the Lord’s decree.

poetryblock.poem: He said to me, ‘You are my Son;
today I have become your Father.

poem.verse: 8Ask of me,

poetryblock.poem: and I will make the nations your inheritance
and the ends of the earth your possession.

poem.verse: 9You will break them with an iron sceptre;

poetryblock.poem: you will shatter them like pottery.’

poem.verse: 10So now, kings, be wise;

poetryblock.poem: receive instruction, you judges of the earth.

poem.verse: 11Serve the Lord with reverential awe

poetryblock.poem: and rejoice with trembling.

poem.verse: 12Pay homage to the Son or he will be angry

poetryblock.poem: and you will perish in your rebellion,
for his anger may ignite at any moment.
All who take refuge in him are happy.

chapter.head2: A psalm of David when he fled from his son Absalom.

poem.verse: 1Lord, how my foes increase!

poetryblock.poem: There are many who attack me.

poem.verse: 2Many say about me,

poetryblock.poem: ‘There is no help for him in God.’'Selah'

poem.verse: 3But you, Lord, are a shield round me,

poetryblock.poem: my glory, and the one who lifts up my head.

poem.verse: 4I cry aloud to the Lord,

poetryblock.poem: and he answers me from his holy mountain.'Selah'

poem.verse: 5I lie down and sleep;

poetryblock.poem: I wake again because the Lord sustains me.

poem.verse: 6I will not be afraid of thousands of people

poetryblock.poem: who have taken their stand against me on every side.

poem.verse: 7Rise up, Lord!

poetryblock.poem: Save me, my God!
You strike all my enemies on the cheek;
you break the teeth of the wicked.

poem.verse: 8Salvation belongs to the Lord;

poetryblock.poem: may your blessing be on your people.'Selah'

chapter.head2: For the choir director: with stringed instruments. A psalm of David.

poem.verse: 1Answer me when I call,

poetryblock.poem: God, who vindicates me.
You freed me from affliction;
be gracious to me and hear my prayer.

poem.verse: 2How long, exalted ones, will my honour be insulted?

poetryblock.poem: How long will you love what is worthless
and pursue a lie?'Selah'

poem.verse: 3Know that the Lord has set apart

poetryblock.poem: the faithful for himself;
the Lord will hear when I call to him.

poem.verse: 4Be angry and do not sin;

poetryblock.poem: reflect in your heart while on your bed and be silent.'Selah'

poem.verse: 5Offer sacrifices in righteousness

poetryblock.poem: and trust in the Lord.

poem.verse: 6Many are asking, ‘Who can show us anything good? ’

poetryblock.poem: Let the light of your face shine on us, Lord.

poem.verse: 7You have put more joy in my heart

poetryblock.poem: than they have when their grain and new wine abound.

poem.verse: 8I will both lie down and sleep in peace,

poetryblock.poem: for you alone, Lord, make me live in safety.

chapter.head2: For the choir director: with the flutes. A psalm of David.

poem.verse: 1Listen to my words, Lord;

poetryblock.poem: consider my sighing.

poem.verse: 2Pay attention to the sound of my cry,

poetryblock.poem: my King and my God,
for I pray to you.

poem.verse: 3In the morning, Lord, you hear my voice;

poetryblock.poem: in the morning I plead my case to you and watch expectantly.

poem.verse: 4For you are not a God who delights in wickedness;

poetryblock.poem: evil cannot dwell with you.

poem.verse: 5The boastful cannot stand in your sight;

poetryblock.poem: you hate all evildoers.

poem.verse: 6You destroy those who tell lies;

poetryblock.poem: the Lord abhors violent and treacherous people.

poem.verse: 7But I enter your house

poetryblock.poem: by the abundance of your faithful love;
I bow down towards your holy temple
in reverential awe of you.

poem.verse: 8Lord, lead me in your righteousness

poetryblock.poem: because of my adversaries;
make your way straight before me.

poem.verse: 9For there is nothing reliable in what they say;

poetryblock.poem: destruction is within them;
their throat is an open grave;
they flatter with their tongues.

poem.verse: 10Punish them, God;

poetryblock.poem: let them fall by their own schemes.
Drive them out because of their many crimes,
for they rebel against you.

poem.verse: 11But let all who take refuge in you rejoice;

poetryblock.poem: let them shout for joy for ever.
May you shelter them,
and may those who love your name boast about you.

poem.verse: 12For you, Lord, bless the righteous one;

poetryblock.poem: you surround him with favour like a shield.

chapter.head2: For the choir director: with stringed instruments, according to 'Sheminith'. A psalm of David.

poem.verse: 1Lord, do not rebuke me in your anger;

poetryblock.poem: do not discipline me in your wrath.

poem.verse: 2Be gracious to me, Lord, for I am weak;

poetryblock.poem: heal me, Lord, for my bones are shaking;

poem.verse: 3my whole being is shaken with terror.

poetryblock.poem: And you, Lord ​– ​how long?

poem.verse: 4Turn, Lord! Rescue me;

poetryblock.poem: save me because of your faithful love.

poem.verse: 5For there is no remembrance of you in death;

poetryblock.poem: who can thank you in Sheol?

poem.verse: 6I am weary from my groaning;

poetryblock.poem: with my tears I dampen my bed
and drench my couch every night.

poem.verse: 7My eyes are swollen from grief;

poetryblock.poem: they grow old because of all my enemies.

poem.verse: 8Depart from me, all evildoers,

poetryblock.poem: for the Lord has heard the sound of my weeping.

poem.verse: 9The Lord has heard my plea for help;

poetryblock.poem: the Lord accepts my prayer.

poem.verse: 10All my enemies will be ashamed and shake with terror;

poetryblock.poem: they will turn back and suddenly be disgraced.

chapter.head2: A 'Shiggaion' of David, which he sang to the Lord concerning the words of Cush, a Benjaminite.

poem.verse: 1Lord my God, I seek refuge in you;

poetryblock.poem: save me from all my pursuers and rescue me,

poem.verse: 2or they will tear me like a lion,

poetryblock.poem: ripping me apart with no one to rescue me.

poem.verse: 3Lord my God, if I have done this,

poetryblock.poem: if there is injustice on my hands,

poem.verse: 4if I have done harm to one at peace with me

poetryblock.poem: or have plundered my adversary without cause,

poem.verse: 5may an enemy pursue and overtake me;

poetryblock.poem: may he trample me to the ground
and leave my honour in the dust.'Selah'

poem.verse: 6Rise up, Lord, in your anger;

poetryblock.poem: lift yourself up against the fury of my adversaries;
awake for me;
you have ordained a judgement.

poem.verse: 7Let the assembly of peoples gather around you;

poetryblock.poem: take your seat on high over it.

poem.verse: 8The Lord judges the peoples;

poetryblock.poem: vindicate me, Lord,
according to my righteousness and my integrity.

poem.verse: 9Let the evil of the wicked come to an end,

poetryblock.poem: but establish the righteous.
The one who examines the thoughts and emotions
is a righteous God.

poem.verse: 10My shield is with God,

poetryblock.poem: who saves the upright in heart.

poem.verse: 11God is a righteous judge

poetryblock.poem: and a God who shows his wrath every day.

poem.verse: 12If anyone does not repent,

poetryblock.poem: he will sharpen his sword;
he has strung his bow and made it ready.

poem.verse: 13He has prepared his deadly weapons;

poetryblock.poem: he tips his arrows with fire.

poem.verse: 14See, the wicked one is pregnant with evil,

poetryblock.poem: conceives trouble, and gives birth to deceit.

poem.verse: 15He dug a pit and hollowed it out

poetryblock.poem: but fell into the hole he had made.

poem.verse: 16His trouble comes back on his own head;

poetryblock.poem: his own violence comes down on top of his head.

poem.verse: 17I will thank the Lord for his righteousness;

poetryblock.poem: I will sing about the name of the Lord Most High.

chapter.head2: For the choir director: on the 'Gittith'. A psalm of David.

poem.verse: 1Lord, our Lord,

poetryblock.poem: how magnificent is your name throughout the earth!
You have covered the heavens with your majesty.

poem.verse: 2From the mouths of infants and nursing babies,

poetryblock.poem: you have established a stronghold
on account of your adversaries
in order to silence the enemy and the avenger.

poem.verse: 3When I observe your heavens,

poetryblock.poem: the work of your fingers,
the moon and the stars,
which you set in place,

poem.verse: 4what is a human being that you remember him,

poetryblock.poem: a son of man that you look after him?

poem.verse: 5You made him a little less than God

poetryblock.poem: and crowned him with glory and honour.

poem.verse: 6You made him ruler over the works of your hands;

poetryblock.poem: you put everything under his feet:

poem.verse: 7all the sheep and oxen,

poetryblock.poem: as well as the animals in the wild,

poem.verse: 8the birds of the sky,

poetryblock.poem: and the fish of the sea
that pass through the currents of the seas.

poem.verse: 9Lord, our Lord,

poetryblock.poem: how magnificent is your name throughout the earth!

chapter.head2: For the choir director: according to 'Muth-labben'. A psalm of David.

poem.verse: 1I will thank the Lord with all my heart;

poetryblock.poem: I will declare all your wondrous works.

poem.verse: 2I will rejoice and boast about you;

poetryblock.poem: I will sing about your name, Most High.

poem.verse: 3When my enemies retreat,

poetryblock.poem: they stumble and perish before you.

poem.verse: 4For you have upheld my just cause;

poetryblock.poem: you are seated on your throne as a righteous judge.

poem.verse: 5You have rebuked the nations:

poetryblock.poem: You have destroyed the wicked;
you have erased their name for ever and ever.

poem.verse: 6The enemy has come to eternal ruin;

poetryblock.poem: you have uprooted the cities,
and the very memory of them has perished.

poem.verse: 7But the Lord sits enthroned for ever;

poetryblock.poem: he has established his throne for judgement.

poem.verse: 8And he judges the world with righteousness;

poetryblock.poem: he executes judgement on the nations with fairness.

poem.verse: 9The Lord is a refuge for the persecuted,

poetryblock.poem: a refuge in times of trouble.

poem.verse: 10Those who know your name trust in you

poetryblock.poem: because you have not abandoned
those who seek you, Lord.

poem.verse: 11Sing to the Lord, who dwells in Zion;

poetryblock.poem: proclaim his deeds among the nations.

poem.verse: 12For the one who seeks an accounting

poetryblock.poem: for bloodshed remembers them;
he does not forget the cry of the oppressed.

poem.verse: 13Be gracious to me, Lord;

poetryblock.poem: consider my affliction at the hands of those who hate me.
Lift me up from the gates of death,

poem.verse: 14so that I may declare all your praises.

poetryblock.poem: I will rejoice in your salvation
within the gates of Daughter Zion.

poem.verse: 15The nations have fallen into the pit they made;

poetryblock.poem: their foot is caught in the net they have concealed.

poem.verse: 16The Lord has made himself known;

poetryblock.poem: he has executed justice,
snaring the wicked
by the work of their hands.'Higgaion'. 'Selah'

poem.verse: 17The wicked will return to Sheol –

poetryblock.poem: all the nations that forget God.

poem.verse: 18For the needy will not always be forgotten;

poetryblock.poem: the hope of the oppressed will not perish for ever.

poem.verse: 19Rise up, Lord! Do not let mere humans prevail;

poetryblock.poem: let the nations be judged in your presence.

poem.verse: 20Put terror in them, Lord;

poetryblock.poem: let the nations know they are only humans.'Selah'

poem.verse: 1Lord, why do you stand so far away?

poetryblock.poem: Why do you hide in times of trouble?

poem.verse: 2In arrogance the wicked relentlessly pursue their victims;

poetryblock.poem: let them be caught in the schemes they have devised.

poem.verse: 3For the wicked one boasts about his own cravings;

poetryblock.poem: the one who is greedy curses and despises the Lord.

poem.verse: 4In all his scheming,

poetryblock.poem: the wicked person arrogantly thinks,
‘There’s no accountability,
since there’s no God.’

poem.verse: 5His ways are always secure;

poetryblock.poem: your lofty judgements have no effect on him;
he scoffs at all his adversaries.

poem.verse: 6He says to himself, ‘I will never be moved –

poetryblock.poem: from generation to generation I will be without calamity.’

poem.verse: 7Cursing, deceit, and violence fill his mouth;

poetryblock.poem: trouble and malice are under his tongue.

poem.verse: 8He waits in ambush near settlements;

poetryblock.poem: he kills the innocent in secret places.
His eyes are on the lookout for the helpless;

poem.verse: 9he lurks in secret like a lion in a thicket.

poetryblock.poem: He lurks in order to seize a victim;
he seizes a victim and drags him in his net.

poem.verse: 10So he is oppressed and beaten down;

poetryblock.poem: helpless people fall because of the wicked one’s strength.

poem.verse: 11He says to himself, ‘God has forgotten;

poetryblock.poem: he hides his face and will never see.’

poem.verse: 12Rise up, Lord God! Lift up your hand.

poetryblock.poem: Do not forget the oppressed.

poem.verse: 13Why has the wicked person despised God?

poetryblock.poem: He says to himself, ‘You will not demand an account.’

poem.verse: 14But you yourself have seen trouble and grief,

poetryblock.poem: observing it in order to take the matter into your hands.
The helpless one entrusts himself to you;
you are a helper of the fatherless.

poem.verse: 15Break the arm of the wicked, evil person,

poetryblock.poem: until you look for his wickedness,
but it can’t be found.

poem.verse: 16The Lord is King for ever and ever;

poetryblock.poem: the nations will perish from his land.

poem.verse: 17Lord, you have heard the desire of the humble;

poetryblock.poem: you will strengthen their hearts.
You will listen carefully,

poem.verse: 18doing justice for the fatherless and the oppressed

poetryblock.poem: so that mere humans from the earth may terrify them no more.

chapter.head2: For the choir director. Of David.

poem.verse: 1I have taken refuge in the Lord.

poetryblock.poem: How can you say to me,
‘Escape to the mountains like a bird!

poem.verse: 2For look, the wicked string bows;

poetryblock.poem: they put their arrows on bowstrings
to shoot from the shadows at the upright in heart.

poem.verse: 3When the foundations are destroyed,

poetryblock.poem: what can the righteous do? ’

poem.verse: 4The Lord is in his holy temple;

poetryblock.poem: the Lord ​– ​his throne is in heaven.
His eyes watch;
his gaze examines everyone.

poem.verse: 5The Lord examines the righteous,

poetryblock.poem: but he hates the wicked
and those who love violence.

poem.verse: 6Let him rain burning coals and sulphur on the wicked;

poetryblock.poem: let a scorching wind be the portion in their cup.

poem.verse: 7For the Lord is righteous; he loves righteous deeds.

poetryblock.poem: The upright will see his face.

chapter.head2: For the choir director: according to 'Sheminith'. A psalm of David.

poem.verse: 1Help, Lord, for no faithful one remains;

poetryblock.poem: the loyal have disappeared from the human race.

poem.verse: 2They lie to one another;

poetryblock.poem: they speak with flattering lips and deceptive hearts.

poem.verse: 3May the Lord cut off all flattering lips

poetryblock.poem: and the tongue that speaks boastfully.

poem.verse: 4They say, ‘Through our tongues we have power;

poetryblock.poem: our lips are our own ​– ​who can be our master? ’

poem.verse: 5‘Because of the devastation of the needy

poetryblock.poem: and the groaning of the poor,
I will now rise up,’ says the Lord.
‘I will provide safety for the one who longs for it.’

poem.verse: 6The words of the Lord are pure words,

poetryblock.poem: like silver refined in an earthen furnace,
purified seven times.

poem.verse: 7You, Lord, will guard us;

poetryblock.poem: you will protect us from this generation for ever.

poem.verse: 8The wicked prowl all around,

poetryblock.poem: and what is worthless is exalted by the human race.

chapter.head2: For the choir director. A psalm of David.

poem.verse: 1How long, Lord? Will you forget me for ever?

poetryblock.poem: How long will you hide your face from me?

poem.verse: 2How long will I store up anxious concerns within me,

poetryblock.poem: agony in my mind every day?
How long will my enemy dominate me?

poem.verse: 3Consider me and answer, Lord my God.

poetryblock.poem: Restore brightness to my eyes;
otherwise, I will sleep in death.

poem.verse: 4My enemy will say, ‘I have triumphed over him,’

poetryblock.poem: and my foes will rejoice because I am shaken.

poem.verse: 5But I have trusted in your faithful love;

poetryblock.poem: my heart will rejoice in your deliverance.

poem.verse: 6I will sing to the Lord

poetryblock.poem: because he has treated me generously.

chapter.head2: For the choir director. Of David.

poem.verse: 1The fool says in his heart, ‘There’s no God.’

poetryblock.poem: They are corrupt; they do vile deeds.
There is no one who does good.

poem.verse: 2The Lord looks down from heaven on the human race

poetryblock.poem: to see if there is one who is wise,
one who seeks God.

poem.verse: 3All have turned away;

poetryblock.poem: all alike have become corrupt.
There is no one who does good,
not even one.

poem.verse: 4Will evildoers never understand?

poetryblock.poem: They consume my people as they consume bread;
they do not call on the Lord.

poem.verse: 5Then they will be filled with dread,

poetryblock.poem: for God is with those who are righteous.

poem.verse: 6You sinners frustrate the plans of the oppressed,

poetryblock.poem: but the Lord is his refuge.

poem.verse: 7Oh, that Israel’s deliverance would come from Zion!

poetryblock.poem: When the Lord restores the fortunes of his people,
let Jacob rejoice, let Israel be glad.

chapter.head2: A psalm of David.

poem.verse: 1Lord, who can dwell in your tent?

poetryblock.poem: Who can live on your holy mountain?

poem.verse: 2The one who lives blamelessly, practises righteousness,

poetryblock.poem: and acknowledges the truth in his heart –

poem.verse: 3who does not slander with his tongue,

poetryblock.poem: who does not harm his friend
or discredit his neighbour,

poem.verse: 4who despises the one rejected by the Lord

poetryblock.poem: but honours those who fear the Lord,
who keeps his word whatever the cost,

poem.verse: 5who does not lend his silver at interest

poetryblock.poem: or take a bribe against the innocent –
the one who does these things will never be shaken.

chapter.head2: A 'Miktam' of David.

poem.verse: 1Protect me, God, for I take refuge in you.
2I said to the Lord, ‘You are my Lord;

poetryblock.poem: I have nothing good besides you’.

poem.verse: 3As for the holy people who are in the land,

poetryblock.poem: they are the noble ones.
All my delight is in them.

poem.verse: 4The sorrows of those who take another god

poetryblock.poem: for themselves will multiply;
I will not pour out their drink offerings of blood,
and I will not speak their names with my lips.

poem.verse: 5Lord, you are my portion

poetryblock.poem: and my cup of blessing;
you hold my future.

poem.verse: 6The boundary lines have fallen for me

poetryblock.poem: in pleasant places;
indeed, I have a beautiful inheritance.

poem.verse: 7I will bless the Lord who counsels me –

poetryblock.poem: even at night when my thoughts trouble me.

poem.verse: 8I always let the Lord guide me.

poetryblock.poem: Because he is at my right hand,
I will not be shaken.

poem.verse: 9Therefore my heart is glad

poetryblock.poem: and my whole being rejoices;
my body also rests securely.

poem.verse: 10For you will not abandon me to Sheol;

poetryblock.poem: you will not allow your faithful one to see decay.

poem.verse: 11You reveal the path of life to me;

poetryblock.poem: in your presence is abundant joy;
at your right hand are eternal pleasures.

chapter.head2: A prayer of David.

poem.verse: 1Lord, hear a just cause;

poetryblock.poem: pay attention to my cry;
listen to my prayer –
from lips free of deceit.

poem.verse: 2Let my vindication come from you,

poetryblock.poem: for you see what is right.

poem.verse: 3You have tested my heart;

poetryblock.poem: you have examined me at night.
You have tried me and found nothing evil;
I have determined that my mouth will not sin.

poem.verse: 4Concerning what people do:

poetryblock.poem: by the words from your lips
I have avoided the ways of the violent.

poem.verse: 5My steps are on your paths;

poetryblock.poem: my feet have not slipped.

poem.verse: 6I call on you, God,

poetryblock.poem: because you will answer me;
listen closely to me; hear what I say.

poem.verse: 7Display the wonders of your faithful love,

poetryblock.poem: Saviour of all who seek refuge
from those who rebel against your right hand.

poem.verse: 8Protect me as the pupil of your eye;

poetryblock.poem: hide me in the shadow of your wings

poem.verse: 9from the wicked who treat me violently,

poetryblock.poem: my deadly enemies who surround me.

poem.verse: 10They are uncaring;

poetryblock.poem: their mouths speak arrogantly.

poem.verse: 11They advance against me; now they surround me.

poetryblock.poem: They are determined
to throw me to the ground.

poem.verse: 12They are like a lion eager to tear,

poetryblock.poem: like a young lion lurking in ambush.

poem.verse: 13Rise up, Lord!

poetryblock.poem: Confront him; bring him down.
With your sword, save me from the wicked.

poem.verse: 14With your hand, Lord, save me from men,

poetryblock.poem: from men of the world
whose portion is in this life:
You fill their bellies with what you have in store;
their sons are satisfied,
and they leave their surplus to their children.

poem.verse: 15But I will see your face in righteousness;

poetryblock.poem: when I awake, I will be satisfied with your presence.

chapter.head2: For the choir director. Of the servant of the Lord, David, who spoke the words of this song to the Lord on the day the Lord rescued him from the grasp of all his enemies and from the power of Saul. He said:

poem.verse: 1I love you, Lord, my strength.
2The Lord is my rock,

poetryblock.poem: my fortress, and my deliverer,
my God, my rock where I seek refuge,
my shield and the horn of my salvation,
my stronghold.

poem.verse: 3I called to the Lord, who is worthy of praise,

poetryblock.poem: and I was saved from my enemies.

poem.verse: 4The ropes of death were wrapped round me;

poetryblock.poem: the torrents of destruction terrified me.

poem.verse: 5The ropes of Sheol entangled me;

poetryblock.poem: the snares of death confronted me.

poem.verse: 6I called to the Lord in my distress,

poetryblock.poem: and I cried to my God for help.
From his temple he heard my voice,
and my cry to him reached his ears.

poem.verse: 7Then the earth shook and quaked;

poetryblock.poem: the foundations of the mountains trembled;
they shook because he burned with anger.

poem.verse: 8Smoke rose from his nostrils,

poetryblock.poem: and consuming fire came from his mouth;
coals were set ablaze by it.

poem.verse: 9He bent the heavens and came down,

poetryblock.poem: total darkness beneath his feet.

poem.verse: 10He rode on a cherub and flew,

poetryblock.poem: soaring on the wings of the wind.

poem.verse: 11He made darkness his hiding place,

poetryblock.poem: dark storm clouds his canopy around him.

poem.verse: 12From the radiance of his presence,

poetryblock.poem: his clouds swept onward with hail and blazing coals.

poem.verse: 13The Lord thundered from heaven;

poetryblock.poem: the Most High made his voice heard.

poem.verse: 14He shot his arrows and scattered them;

poetryblock.poem: he hurled lightning bolts and routed them.

poem.verse: 15The depths of the sea became visible,

poetryblock.poem: the foundations of the world were exposed,
at your rebuke, Lord,
at the blast of the breath of your nostrils.

poem.verse: 16He reached down from on high

poetryblock.poem: and took hold of me;
he pulled me out of deep water.

poem.verse: 17He rescued me from my powerful enemy

poetryblock.poem: and from those who hated me,
for they were too strong for me.

poem.verse: 18They confronted me in the day of my calamity,

poetryblock.poem: but the Lord was my support.

poem.verse: 19He brought me out to a spacious place;

poetryblock.poem: he rescued me because he delighted in me.

poem.verse: 20The Lord rewarded me

poetryblock.poem: according to my righteousness;
he repaid me
according to the cleanness of my hands.

poem.verse: 21For I have kept the ways of the Lord

poetryblock.poem: and have not turned from my God to wickedness.

poem.verse: 22Indeed, I let all his ordinances guide me

poetryblock.poem: and have not disregarded his statutes.

poem.verse: 23I was blameless towards him

poetryblock.poem: and kept myself from my iniquity.

poem.verse: 24So the Lord repaid me

poetryblock.poem: according to my righteousness,
according to the cleanness of my hands in his sight.

poem.verse: 25With the faithful

poetryblock.poem: you prove yourself faithful,
with the blameless
you prove yourself blameless,

poem.verse: 26with the pure

poetryblock.poem: you prove yourself pure,
but with the crooked
you prove yourself shrewd.

poem.verse: 27For you rescue an oppressed people,

poetryblock.poem: but you humble those with haughty eyes.

poem.verse: 28Lord, you light my lamp;

poetryblock.poem: my God illuminates my darkness.

poem.verse: 29With you I can attack a barricade,

poetryblock.poem: and with my God I can leap over a wall.

poem.verse: 30God ​– ​his way is perfect;

poetryblock.poem: the word of the Lord is pure.
He is a shield to all who take refuge in him.

poem.verse: 31For who is God besides the Lord?

poetryblock.poem: And who is a rock? Only our God.

poem.verse: 32God ​– ​he clothes me with strength

poetryblock.poem: and makes my way perfect.

poem.verse: 33He makes my feet like the feet of a deer

poetryblock.poem: and sets me securely on the heights.

poem.verse: 34He trains my hands for war;

poetryblock.poem: my arms can bend a bow of bronze.

poem.verse: 35You have given me the shield of your salvation;

poetryblock.poem: your right hand upholds me,
and your humility exalts me.

poem.verse: 36You make a spacious place beneath me for my steps,

poetryblock.poem: and my ankles do not give way.

poem.verse: 37I pursue my enemies and overtake them;

poetryblock.poem: I do not turn back until they are wiped out.

poem.verse: 38I crush them, and they cannot get up;

poetryblock.poem: they fall beneath my feet.

poem.verse: 39You have clothed me with strength for battle;

poetryblock.poem: you subdue my adversaries beneath me.

poem.verse: 40You have made my enemies retreat before me;

poetryblock.poem: I annihilate those who hate me.

poem.verse: 41They cry for help, but there is no one to save them –

poetryblock.poem: they cry to the Lord, but he does not answer them.

poem.verse: 42I pulverise them like dust before the wind;

poetryblock.poem: I trample them like mud in the streets.

poem.verse: 43You have freed me from the feuds among the people;

poetryblock.poem: you have appointed me the head of nations;
a people I had not known serve me.

poem.verse: 44Foreigners submit to me cringing;

poetryblock.poem: as soon as they hear they obey me.

poem.verse: 45Foreigners lose heart

poetryblock.poem: and come trembling from their fortifications.

poem.verse: 46The Lord lives ​– ​blessed be my rock!

poetryblock.poem: The God of my salvation is exalted.

poem.verse: 47God ​– ​he grants me vengeance

poetryblock.poem: and subdues peoples under me.

poem.verse: 48He frees me from my enemies.

poetryblock.poem: You exalt me above my adversaries;
you rescue me from violent men.

poem.verse: 49Therefore I will give thanks to you among the nations, Lord;

poetryblock.poem: I will sing praises about your name.

poem.verse: 50He gives great victories to his king;

poetryblock.poem: he shows loyalty to his anointed,
to David and his descendants for ever.

chapter.head1: The Witness of Creation and Scripture
chapter.head2: For the choir director. A psalm of David.

poem.verse: 1The heavens declare the glory of God,

poetryblock.poem: and the expanse proclaims the work of his hands.

poem.verse: 2Day after day they pour out speech;

poetryblock.poem: night after night they communicate knowledge.

poem.verse: 3There is no speech; there are no words;

poetryblock.poem: their voice is not heard.

poem.verse: 4Their message has gone out to the whole earth,

poetryblock.poem: and their words to the ends of the world.
In the heavens he has pitched a tent for the sun.

poem.verse: 5It is like a bridegroom coming from his home;

poetryblock.poem: it rejoices like an athlete running a course.

poem.verse: 6It rises from one end of the heavens

poetryblock.poem: and circles to their other end;
nothing is hidden from its heat.

poem.verse: 7The instruction of the Lord is perfect,

poetryblock.poem: renewing one’s life;
the testimony of the Lord is trustworthy,
making the inexperienced wise.

poem.verse: 8The precepts of the Lord are right,

poetryblock.poem: making the heart glad;
the command of the Lord is radiant,
making the eyes light up.

poem.verse: 9The fear of the Lord is pure,

poetryblock.poem: enduring for ever;
the ordinances of the Lord are reliable
and altogether righteous.

poem.verse: 10They are more desirable than gold –

poetryblock.poem: than an abundance of pure gold;
and sweeter than honey
dripping from a honeycomb.

poem.verse: 11In addition, your servant is warned by them,

poetryblock.poem: and in keeping them there is an abundant reward.

poem.verse: 12Who perceives his unintentional sins?

poetryblock.poem: Cleanse me from my hidden faults.

poem.verse: 13Moreover, keep your servant from wilful sins;

poetryblock.poem: do not let them rule me.
Then I will be blameless
and cleansed from blatant rebellion.

poem.verse: 14May the words of my mouth

poetryblock.poem: and the meditation of my heart
be acceptable to you,
Lord, my rock and my Redeemer.

chapter.head2: For the choir director. A psalm of David.

poem.verse: 1May the Lord answer you in a day of trouble;

poetryblock.poem: may the name of Jacob’s God protect you.

poem.verse: 2May he send you help from the sanctuary

poetryblock.poem: and sustain you from Zion.

poem.verse: 3May he remember all your offerings

poetryblock.poem: and accept your burnt offering.'Selah'

poem.verse: 4May he give you what your heart desires

poetryblock.poem: and fulfil your whole purpose.

poem.verse: 5Let us shout for joy at your victory

poetryblock.poem: and lift the banner in the name of our God.
May the Lord fulfil all your requests.

poem.verse: 6Now I know that the Lord gives victory to his anointed;

poetryblock.poem: he will answer him from his holy heaven
with mighty victories from his right hand.

poem.verse: 7Some take pride in chariots, and others in horses,

poetryblock.poem: but we take pride in the name of the Lord our God.

poem.verse: 8They collapse and fall,

poetryblock.poem: but we rise and stand firm.

poem.verse: 9Lord, give victory to the king!

poetryblock.poem: May he answer us on the day that we call.

chapter.head2: For the choir director. A psalm of David.

poem.verse: 1Lord, the king finds joy in your strength.

poetryblock.poem: How greatly he rejoices in your victory!

poem.verse: 2You have given him his heart’s desire

poetryblock.poem: and have not denied the request of his lips.'Selah'

poem.verse: 3For you meet him with rich blessings;

poetryblock.poem: you place a crown of pure gold on his head.

poem.verse: 4He asked you for life, and you gave it to him –

poetryblock.poem: length of days for ever and ever.

poem.verse: 5His glory is great through your victory;

poetryblock.poem: you confer majesty and splendour on him.

poem.verse: 6You give him blessings for ever;

poetryblock.poem: you cheer him with joy in your presence.

poem.verse: 7For the king relies on the Lord;

poetryblock.poem: through the faithful love of the Most High
he is not shaken.

poem.verse: 8Your hand will capture all your enemies;

poetryblock.poem: your right hand will seize those who hate you.

poem.verse: 9You will make them burn

poetryblock.poem: like a fiery furnace when you appear;
the Lord will engulf them in his wrath,
and fire will devour them.

poem.verse: 10You will wipe their progeny from the earth

poetryblock.poem: and their offspring from the human race.

poem.verse: 11Though they intend to harm you

poetryblock.poem: and devise a wicked plan, they will not prevail.

poem.verse: 12Instead, you will put them to flight

poetryblock.poem: when you ready your bowstrings to shoot at them.

poem.verse: 13Be exalted, Lord, in your strength;

poetryblock.poem: we will sing and praise your might.

chapter.head2: For the choir director: according to ‘The Deer of the Dawn.’ A psalm of David.

poem.verse: 1My God, my God, why have you abandoned me?

poetryblock.poem: Why are you so far from my deliverance
and from my words of groaning?

poem.verse: 2My God, I cry by day, but you do not answer,

poetryblock.poem: by night, yet I have no rest.

poem.verse: 3But you are holy,

poetryblock.poem: enthroned on the praises of Israel.

poem.verse: 4Our ancestors trusted in you;

poetryblock.poem: they trusted, and you rescued them.

poem.verse: 5They cried to you and were set free;

poetryblock.poem: they trusted in you and were not disgraced.

poem.verse: 6But I am a worm and not a man,

poetryblock.poem: scorned by mankind and despised by people.

poem.verse: 7Everyone who sees me mocks me;

poetryblock.poem: they sneer and shake their heads:

poem.verse: 8‘He relies on the Lord;

poetryblock.poem: let him save him;
let the Lord rescue him,
since he takes pleasure in him.’

poem.verse: 9It was you who brought me out of the womb,

poetryblock.poem: making me secure at my mother’s breast.

poem.verse: 10I was given over to you at birth;

poetryblock.poem: you have been my God from my mother’s womb.

poem.verse: 11Don’t be far from me, because distress is near

poetryblock.poem: and there’s no one to help.

poem.verse: 12Many bulls surround me;

poetryblock.poem: strong ones of Bashan encircle me.

poem.verse: 13They open their mouths against me –

poetryblock.poem: lions, mauling and roaring.

poem.verse: 14I am poured out like water,

poetryblock.poem: and all my bones are disjointed;
my heart is like wax,
melting within me.

poem.verse: 15My strength is dried up like baked clay;

poetryblock.poem: my tongue sticks to the roof of my mouth.
You put me into the dust of death.

poem.verse: 16For dogs have surrounded me;

poetryblock.poem: a gang of evildoers has closed in on me;
they pierced my hands and my feet.

poem.verse: 17I can count all my bones;

poetryblock.poem: people look and stare at me.

poem.verse: 18They divided my garments among themselves,

poetryblock.poem: and they cast lots for my clothing.

poem.verse: 19But you, Lord, don’t be far away.

poetryblock.poem: My strength, come quickly to help me.

poem.verse: 20Rescue my life from the sword,

poetryblock.poem: my only life from the power of these dogs.

poem.verse: 21Save me from the lion’s mouth,

poetryblock.poem: from the horns of wild oxen.
You answered me!

poem.verse: 22I will proclaim your name to my brothers and sisters;

poetryblock.poem: I will praise you in the assembly.

poem.verse: 23You who fear the Lord, praise him!

poetryblock.poem: All you descendants of Jacob, honour him!
All you descendants of Israel, revere him!

poem.verse: 24For he has not despised or abhorred

poetryblock.poem: the torment of the oppressed.
He did not hide his face from him
but listened when he cried to him for help.

poem.verse: 25I will give praise in the great assembly

poetryblock.poem: because of you;
I will fulfil my vows
before those who fear you.

poem.verse: 26The humble will eat and be satisfied;

poetryblock.poem: those who seek the Lord will praise him.
May your hearts live for ever!

poem.verse: 27All the ends of the earth will remember

poetryblock.poem: and turn to the Lord.
All the families of the nations
will bow down before you,

poem.verse: 28for kingship belongs to the Lord;

poetryblock.poem: he rules the nations.

poem.verse: 29All who prosper on earth will eat and bow down;

poetryblock.poem: all those who go down to the dust
will kneel before him –
even the one who cannot preserve his life.

poem.verse: 30Their descendants will serve him;

poetryblock.poem: the next generation will be told about the Lord.

poem.verse: 31They will come and declare his righteousness;

poetryblock.poem: to a people yet to be born
they will declare what he has done.

chapter.head2: A psalm of David.

poem.verse: 1The Lord is my shepherd;

poetryblock.poem: I have what I need.

poem.verse: 2He lets me lie down in green pastures;

poetryblock.poem: he leads me beside quiet waters.

poem.verse: 3He renews my life;

poetryblock.poem: he leads me along the right paths
for his name’s sake.

poem.verse: 4Even when I go through the darkest valley,

poetryblock.poem: I fear no danger,
for you are with me;
your rod and your staff ​– ​they comfort me.

poem.verse: 5You prepare a table before me

poetryblock.poem: in the presence of my enemies;
you anoint my head with oil;
my cup overflows.

poem.verse: 6Only goodness and faithful love will pursue me

poetryblock.poem: all the days of my life,
and I will dwell in the house of the Lord
as long as I live.

chapter.head2: A psalm of David.

poem.verse: 1The earth and everything in it,

poetryblock.poem: the world and its inhabitants,
belong to the Lord;

poem.verse: 2for he laid its foundation on the seas

poetryblock.poem: and established it on the rivers.

poem.verse: 3Who may ascend the mountain of the Lord?

poetryblock.poem: Who may stand in his holy place?

poem.verse: 4The one who has clean hands and a pure heart,

poetryblock.poem: who has not appealed to what is false,
and who has not sworn deceitfully.

poem.verse: 5He will receive blessing from the Lord,

poetryblock.poem: and righteousness from the God of his salvation.

poem.verse: 6Such is the generation of those who enquire of him,

poetryblock.poem: who seek the face of the God of Jacob.'Selah'

poem.verse: 7Lift up your heads, you gates!

poetryblock.poem: Rise up, ancient doors!
Then the King of glory will come in.

poem.verse: 8Who is this King of glory?

poetryblock.poem: The Lord, strong and mighty,
the Lord, mighty in battle.

poem.verse: 9Lift up your heads, you gates!

poetryblock.poem: Rise up, ancient doors!
Then the King of glory will come in.

poem.verse: 10Who is he, this King of glory?

poetryblock.poem: The Lord of Armies,
he is the King of glory.'Selah'

chapter.head2: Of David.

poem.verse: 1Lord, I appeal to you.
2My God, I trust in you.

poetryblock.poem: Do not let me be disgraced;
do not let my enemies gloat over me.

poem.verse: 3No one who waits for you

poetryblock.poem: will be disgraced;
those who act treacherously without cause
will be disgraced.

poem.verse: 4Make your ways known to me, Lord;

poetryblock.poem: teach me your paths.

poem.verse: 5Guide me in your truth and teach me,

poetryblock.poem: for you are the God of my salvation;
I wait for you all day long.

poem.verse: 6Remember, Lord, your compassion

poetryblock.poem: and your faithful love,
for they have existed from antiquity.

poem.verse: 7Do not remember the sins of my youth

poetryblock.poem: or my acts of rebellion;
in keeping with your faithful love, remember me
because of your goodness, Lord.

poem.verse: 8The Lord is good and upright;

poetryblock.poem: therefore he shows sinners the way.

poem.verse: 9He leads the humble in what is right

poetryblock.poem: and teaches them his way.

poem.verse: 10All the Lord’s ways show faithful love and truth

poetryblock.poem: to those who keep his covenant and decrees.

poem.verse: 11Lord, for the sake of your name,

poetryblock.poem: forgive my iniquity, for it is immense.

poem.verse: 12Who is this person who fears the Lord?

poetryblock.poem: He will show him the way he should choose.

poem.verse: 13He will live a good life,

poetryblock.poem: and his descendants will inherit the land.

poem.verse: 14The secret counsel of the Lord

poetryblock.poem: is for those who fear him,
and he reveals his covenant to them.

poem.verse: 15My eyes are always on the Lord,

poetryblock.poem: for he will pull my feet out of the net.

poem.verse: 16Turn to me and be gracious to me,

poetryblock.poem: for I am alone and afflicted.

poem.verse: 17The distresses of my heart increase;

poetryblock.poem: bring me out of my sufferings.

poem.verse: 18Consider my affliction and trouble,

poetryblock.poem: and forgive all my sins.

poem.verse: 19Consider my enemies; they are numerous,

poetryblock.poem: and they hate me violently.

poem.verse: 20Guard me and rescue me;

poetryblock.poem: do not let me be disgraced,
for I take refuge in you.

poem.verse: 21May integrity and what is right

poetryblock.poem: watch over me,
for I wait for you.

poem.verse: 22God, redeem Israel, from all its distresses.

chapter.head2: Of David.

poem.verse: 1Vindicate me, Lord,

poetryblock.poem: because I have lived with integrity
and have trusted in the Lord without wavering.

poem.verse: 2Test me, Lord, and try me;

poetryblock.poem: examine my heart and mind.

poem.verse: 3For your faithful love guides me,

poetryblock.poem: and I live by your truth.

poem.verse: 4I do not sit with the worthless

poetryblock.poem: or associate with hypocrites.

poem.verse: 5I hate a crowd of evildoers,

poetryblock.poem: and I do not sit with the wicked.

poem.verse: 6I wash my hands in innocence

poetryblock.poem: and go round your altar, Lord,

poem.verse: 7raising my voice in thanksgiving

poetryblock.poem: and telling about your wondrous works.

poem.verse: 8Lord, I love the house where you dwell,

poetryblock.poem: the place where your glory resides.

poem.verse: 9Do not destroy me along with sinners,

poetryblock.poem: or my life along with men of bloodshed

poem.verse: 10in whose hands are evil schemes

poetryblock.poem: and whose right hands are filled with bribes.

poem.verse: 11But I live with integrity;

poetryblock.poem: redeem me and be gracious to me.

poem.verse: 12My foot stands on level ground;

poetryblock.poem: I will bless the Lord in the assemblies.

chapter.head2: Of David.

poem.verse: 1The Lord is my light and my salvation –

poetryblock.poem: whom should I fear?
The Lord is the stronghold of my life –
whom should I dread?

poem.verse: 2When evildoers came against me to devour my flesh,

poetryblock.poem: my foes and my enemies stumbled and fell.

poem.verse: 3Though an army deploys against me,

poetryblock.poem: my heart will not be afraid;
though a war breaks out against me,
I will still be confident.

poem.verse: 4I have asked one thing from the Lord;

poetryblock.poem: it is what I desire:
to dwell in the house of the Lord
all the days of my life,
gazing on the beauty of the Lord
and seeking him in his temple.

poem.verse: 5For he will conceal me in his shelter

poetryblock.poem: in the day of adversity;
he will hide me under the cover of his tent;
he will set me high on a rock.

poem.verse: 6Then my head will be high

poetryblock.poem: above my enemies around me;
I will offer sacrifices in his tent with shouts of joy.
I will sing and make music to the Lord.

poem.verse: 7Lord, hear my voice when I call;

poetryblock.poem: be gracious to me and answer me.

poem.verse: 8My heart says this about you:

poetryblock.poem: ‘Seek his face.’
Lord, I will seek your face.

poem.verse: 9Do not hide your face from me;

poetryblock.poem: do not turn your servant away in anger.
You have been my helper;
do not leave me or abandon me,
God of my salvation.

poem.verse: 10Even if my father and mother abandon me,

poetryblock.poem: the Lord cares for me.

poem.verse: 11Because of my adversaries,

poetryblock.poem: show me your way, Lord,
and lead me on a level path.

poem.verse: 12Do not give me over to the will of my foes,

poetryblock.poem: for false witnesses rise up against me,
breathing violence.

poem.verse: 13I am certain that I will see the Lord’s goodness

poetryblock.poem: in the land of the living.

poem.verse: 14Wait for the Lord;

poetryblock.poem: be strong, and let your heart be courageous.
Wait for the Lord.

chapter.head2: Of David.

poem.verse: 1Lord, I call to you;

poetryblock.poem: my rock, do not be deaf to me.
If you remain silent to me,
I will be like those going down to the Pit.

poem.verse: 2Listen to the sound of my pleading

poetryblock.poem: when I cry to you for help,
when I lift up my hands
towards your holy sanctuary.

poem.verse: 3Do not drag me away with the wicked,

poetryblock.poem: with the evildoers,
who speak in friendly ways with their neighbours
while malice is in their hearts.

poem.verse: 4Repay them according to what they have done –

poetryblock.poem: according to the evil of their deeds.
Repay them according to the work of their hands;
give them back what they deserve.

poem.verse: 5Because they do not consider

poetryblock.poem: what the Lord has done
or the work of his hands,
he will tear them down and not rebuild them.

poem.verse: 6Blessed be the Lord,

poetryblock.poem: for he has heard the sound of my pleading.

poem.verse: 7The Lord is my strength and my shield;

poetryblock.poem: my heart trusts in him, and I am helped.
Therefore my heart celebrates,
and I give thanks to him with my song.

poem.verse: 8The Lord is the strength of his people;

poetryblock.poem: he is a stronghold of salvation for his anointed.

poem.verse: 9Save your people, bless your possession,

poetryblock.poem: shepherd them, and carry them for ever.

chapter.head2: A psalm of David.

poem.verse: 1Ascribe to the Lord, you heavenly beings,

poetryblock.poem: ascribe to the Lord glory and strength.

poem.verse: 2Ascribe to the Lord the glory due his name;

poetryblock.poem: worship the Lord
in the splendour of his holiness.

poem.verse: 3The voice of the Lord is above the waters.

poetryblock.poem: The God of glory thunders –
the Lord, above the vast water,

poem.verse: 4the voice of the Lord in power,

poetryblock.poem: the voice of the Lord in splendour.

poem.verse: 5The voice of the Lord breaks the cedars;

poetryblock.poem: the Lord shatters the cedars of Lebanon.

poem.verse: 6He makes Lebanon skip like a calf,

poetryblock.poem: and Sirion, like a young wild ox.

poem.verse: 7The voice of the Lord flashes flames of fire.
8The voice of the Lord shakes the wilderness;

poetryblock.poem: the Lord shakes the wilderness of Kadesh.

poem.verse: 9The voice of the Lord makes the deer give birth

poetryblock.poem: and strips the woodlands bare.
In his temple all cry, ‘Glory! ’

poem.verse: 10The Lord sits enthroned over the flood;

poetryblock.poem: the Lord sits enthroned, King for ever.

poem.verse: 11The Lord gives his people strength;

poetryblock.poem: the Lord blesses his people with peace.

chapter.head2: A psalm; a dedication song for the house. Of David.

poem.verse: 1I will exalt you, Lord,

poetryblock.poem: because you have lifted me up
and have not allowed my enemies
to triumph over me.

poem.verse: 2Lord my God,

poetryblock.poem: I cried to you for help, and you healed me.

poem.verse: 3Lord, you brought me up from Sheol;

poetryblock.poem: you spared me from among those
going down to the Pit.

poem.verse: 4Sing to the Lord, you his faithful ones,

poetryblock.poem: and praise his holy name.

poem.verse: 5For his anger lasts only a moment,

poetryblock.poem: but his favour, a lifetime.
Weeping may stay overnight,
but there is joy in the morning.

poem.verse: 6When I was secure, I said,

poetryblock.poem: ‘I will never be shaken.’

poem.verse: 7Lord, when you showed your favour,

poetryblock.poem: you made me stand like a strong mountain;
when you hid your face, I was terrified.

poem.verse: 8Lord, I called to you;

poetryblock.poem: I sought favour from my Lord:

poem.verse: 9‘What gain is there in my death,

poetryblock.poem: if I go down to the Pit?
Will the dust praise you?
Will it proclaim your truth?

poem.verse: 10Lord, listen and be gracious to me;

poetryblock.poem: Lord, be my helper.’

poem.verse: 11You turned my lament into dancing;

poetryblock.poem: you removed my sackcloth
and clothed me with gladness,

poem.verse: 12so that I can sing to you and not be silent.

poetryblock.poem: Lord my God, I will praise you for ever.

chapter.head2: For the choir director. A psalm of David.

poem.verse: 1Lord, I seek refuge in you;

poetryblock.poem: let me never be disgraced.
Save me by your righteousness.

poem.verse: 2Listen closely to me; rescue me quickly.

poetryblock.poem: Be a rock of refuge for me,
a mountain fortress to save me.

poem.verse: 3For you are my rock and my fortress;

poetryblock.poem: you lead and guide me
for your name’s sake.

poem.verse: 4You will free me from the net

poetryblock.poem: that is secretly set for me,
for you are my refuge.

poem.verse: 5Into your hand I entrust my spirit;

poetryblock.poem: you have redeemed me, Lord, God of truth.

poem.verse: 6I hate those who are devoted to worthless idols,

poetryblock.poem: but I trust in the Lord.

poem.verse: 7I will rejoice and be glad in your faithful love

poetryblock.poem: because you have seen my affliction.
You know the troubles of my soul

poem.verse: 8and have not handed me over to the enemy.

poetryblock.poem: You have set my feet in a spacious place.

poem.verse: 9Be gracious to me, Lord,

poetryblock.poem: because I am in distress;
my eyes are worn out from frustration –
my whole being as well.

poem.verse: 10Indeed, my life is consumed with grief

poetryblock.poem: and my years with groaning;
my strength has failed
because of my iniquity,
and my bones waste away.

poem.verse: 11I am ridiculed by all my adversaries

poetryblock.poem: and even by my neighbours.
I am dreaded by my acquaintances;
those who see me in the street run from me.

poem.verse: 12I am forgotten: gone from memory

poetryblock.poem: like a dead person ​– ​like broken pottery.

poem.verse: 13I have heard the gossip of many;

poetryblock.poem: terror is on every side.
When they conspired against me,
they plotted to take my life.

poem.verse: 14But I trust in you, Lord;

poetryblock.poem: I say, ‘You are my God.’

poem.verse: 15The course of my life is in your power;

poetryblock.poem: rescue me from the power of my enemies
and from my persecutors.

poem.verse: 16Make your face shine on your servant;

poetryblock.poem: save me by your faithful love.

poem.verse: 17Lord, do not let me be disgraced when I call on you.

poetryblock.poem: Let the wicked be disgraced;
let them be quiet in Sheol.

poem.verse: 18Let lying lips

poetryblock.poem: that arrogantly speak against the righteous
in proud contempt be silenced.

poem.verse: 19How great is your goodness,

poetryblock.poem: which you have stored up for those who fear you.
In the presence of everyone you have acted
for those who take refuge in you.

poem.verse: 20You hide them in the protection of your presence;

poetryblock.poem: you conceal them in a shelter
from human schemes,
from quarrelsome tongues.

poem.verse: 21Blessed be the Lord,

poetryblock.poem: for he has wondrously shown his faithful love to me
in a city under siege.

poem.verse: 22In my alarm I said,

poetryblock.poem: ‘I am cut off from your sight.’
But you heard the sound of my pleading
when I cried to you for help.

poem.verse: 23Love the Lord, all his faithful ones.

poetryblock.poem: The Lord protects the loyal,
but fully repays the arrogant.

poem.verse: 24Be strong, and let your heart be courageous,

poetryblock.poem: all you who put your hope in the Lord.

chapter.head2: Of David. A 'Maskil'.

poem.verse: 1How joyful is the one

poetryblock.poem: whose transgression is forgiven,
whose sin is covered!

poem.verse: 2How joyful is a person whom

poetryblock.poem: the Lord does not charge with iniquity
and in whose spirit is no deceit!

poem.verse: 3When I kept silent, my bones became brittle

poetryblock.poem: from my groaning all day long.

poem.verse: 4For day and night your hand was heavy on me;

poetryblock.poem: my strength was drained
as in the summer’s heat.'Selah'

poem.verse: 5Then I acknowledged my sin to you

poetryblock.poem: and did not conceal my iniquity.
I said, ‘I will confess my transgressions to the Lord,’
and you forgave the guilt of my sin.'Selah'

poem.verse: 6Therefore let everyone who is faithful pray to you immediately.

poetryblock.poem: When great floodwaters come,
they will not reach him.

poem.verse: 7You are my hiding place;

poetryblock.poem: you protect me from trouble.
You surround me with joyful shouts of deliverance.'Selah'

poem.verse: 8I will instruct you and show you the way to go;

poetryblock.poem: with my eye on you, I will give counsel.

poem.verse: 9Do not be like a horse or mule,

poetryblock.poem: without understanding,
that must be controlled with bit and bridle
or else it will not come near you.

poem.verse: 10Many pains come to the wicked,

poetryblock.poem: but the one who trusts in the Lord
will have faithful love surrounding him.

poem.verse: 11Be glad in the Lord and rejoice,

poetryblock.poem: you righteous ones;
shout for joy,
all you upright in heart.

poem.verse: 1Rejoice in the Lord, you righteous ones;

poetryblock.poem: praise from the upright is beautiful.

poem.verse: 2Praise the Lord with the lyre;

poetryblock.poem: make music to him with a ten-stringed harp.

poem.verse: 3Sing a new song to him;

poetryblock.poem: play skilfully on the strings, with a joyful shout.

poem.verse: 4For the word of the Lord is right,

poetryblock.poem: and all his work is trustworthy.

poem.verse: 5He loves righteousness and justice;

poetryblock.poem: the earth is full of the Lord’s unfailing love.

poem.verse: 6The heavens were made by the word of the Lord,

poetryblock.poem: and all the stars, by the breath of his mouth.

poem.verse: 7He gathers the water of the sea into a heap;

poetryblock.poem: he puts the depths into storehouses.

poem.verse: 8Let the whole earth fear the Lord;

poetryblock.poem: let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of him.

poem.verse: 9For he spoke, and it came into being;

poetryblock.poem: he commanded, and it came into existence.

poem.verse: 10The Lord frustrates the counsel of the nations;

poetryblock.poem: he thwarts the plans of the peoples.

poem.verse: 11The counsel of the Lord stands for ever,

poetryblock.poem: the plans of his heart from generation to generation.

poem.verse: 12Happy is the nation whose God is the Lord –

poetryblock.poem: the people he has chosen to be his own possession!

poem.verse: 13The Lord looks down from heaven;

poetryblock.poem: he observes everyone.

poem.verse: 14He gazes on all the inhabitants of the earth

poetryblock.poem: from his dwelling place.

poem.verse: 15He forms the hearts of them all;

poetryblock.poem: he considers all their works.

poem.verse: 16A king is not saved by a large army;

poetryblock.poem: a warrior will not be rescued by great strength.

poem.verse: 17The horse is a false hope for safety;

poetryblock.poem: it provides no escape by its great power.

poem.verse: 18But look, the Lord keeps his eye on those who fear him –

poetryblock.poem: those who depend on his faithful love

poem.verse: 19to rescue them from death

poetryblock.poem: and to keep them alive in famine.

poem.verse: 20We wait for the Lord;

poetryblock.poem: he is our help and shield.

poem.verse: 21For our hearts rejoice in him

poetryblock.poem: because we trust in his holy name.

poem.verse: 22May your faithful love rest on us, Lord,

poetryblock.poem: for we put our hope in you.

chapter.head2: Concerning David, when he pretended to be insane in the presence of Abimelech, who drove him out, and he departed.

poem.verse: 1I will bless the Lord at all times;

poetryblock.poem: his praise will always be on my lips.

poem.verse: 2I will boast in the Lord;

poetryblock.poem: the humble will hear and be glad.

poem.verse: 3Proclaim the Lord’s greatness with me;

poetryblock.poem: let us exalt his name together.

poem.verse: 4I sought the Lord, and he answered me

poetryblock.poem: and rescued me from all my fears.

poem.verse: 5Those who look to him are radiant with joy;

poetryblock.poem: their faces will never be ashamed.

poem.verse: 6This poor man cried, and the Lord heard him

poetryblock.poem: and saved him from all his troubles.

poem.verse: 7The angel of the Lord camps

poetryblock.poem: round those who fear him, and rescues them.

poem.verse: 8Taste and see that the Lord is good.

poetryblock.poem: How happy is the person who takes refuge in him!

poem.verse: 9You who are his holy ones, fear the Lord,

poetryblock.poem: for those who fear him lack nothing.

poem.verse: 10Young lions lack food and go hungry,

poetryblock.poem: but those who seek the Lord
will not lack any good thing.

poem.verse: 11Come, children, listen to me;

poetryblock.poem: I will teach you the fear of the Lord.

poem.verse: 12Who is someone who desires life,

poetryblock.poem: loving a long life to enjoy what is good?

poem.verse: 13Keep your tongue from evil

poetryblock.poem: and your lips from deceitful speech.

poem.verse: 14Turn away from evil and do what is good;

poetryblock.poem: seek peace and pursue it.

poem.verse: 15The eyes of the Lord are on the righteous,

poetryblock.poem: and his ears are open to their cry for help.

poem.verse: 16The face of the Lord is set

poetryblock.poem: against those who do what is evil,
to remove all memory of them from the earth.

poem.verse: 17The righteous cry out, and the Lord hears,

poetryblock.poem: and rescues them from all their troubles.

poem.verse: 18The Lord is near the broken-hearted;

poetryblock.poem: he saves those crushed in spirit.

poem.verse: 19One who is righteous has many adversities,

poetryblock.poem: but the Lord rescues him from them all.

poem.verse: 20He protects all his bones;

poetryblock.poem: not one of them is broken.

poem.verse: 21Evil brings death to the wicked,

poetryblock.poem: and those who hate the righteous will be punished.

poem.verse: 22The Lord redeems the life of his servants,

poetryblock.poem: and all who take refuge in him will not be punished.

chapter.head2: Of David.

poem.verse: 1Oppose my opponents, Lord;

poetryblock.poem: fight those who fight me.

poem.verse: 2Take your shields ​– ​large and small –

poetryblock.poem: and come to my aid.

poem.verse: 3Draw the spear and javelin against my pursuers,

poetryblock.poem: and assure me, ‘I am your deliverance.’

poem.verse: 4Let those who intend to take my life

poetryblock.poem: be disgraced and humiliated;
let those who plan to harm me
be turned back and ashamed.

poem.verse: 5Let them be like chaff in the wind,

poetryblock.poem: with the angel of the Lord driving them away.

poem.verse: 6Let their way be dark and slippery,

poetryblock.poem: with the angel of the Lord pursuing them.

poem.verse: 7They hid their net for me without cause;

poetryblock.poem: they dug a pit for me without cause.

poem.verse: 8Let ruin come on him unexpectedly,

poetryblock.poem: and let the net that he hid ensnare him;
let him fall into it ​– ​to his ruin.

poem.verse: 9Then I will rejoice in the Lord;

poetryblock.poem: I will delight in his deliverance.

poem.verse: 10All my bones will say,

poetryblock.poem: ‘Lord, who is like you,
rescuing the poor from one too strong for him,
the poor or the needy from one who robs him? ’

poem.verse: 11Malicious witnesses come forward;

poetryblock.poem: they question me about things I do not know.

poem.verse: 12They repay me evil for good,

poetryblock.poem: making me desolate.

poem.verse: 13Yet when they were ill,

poetryblock.poem: my clothing was sackcloth;
I humbled myself with fasting,
and my prayer was genuine.

poem.verse: 14I went about mourning as if for my friend or brother;

poetryblock.poem: I was bowed down with grief,
like one mourning for a mother.

poem.verse: 15But when I stumbled, they gathered in glee;

poetryblock.poem: they gathered against me.
Assailants I did not know
tore at me and did not stop.

poem.verse: 16With godless mockery

poetryblock.poem: they gnashed their teeth at me.

poem.verse: 17Lord, how long will you look on?

poetryblock.poem: Rescue me from their ravages;
rescue my precious life from the young lions.

poem.verse: 18I will praise you in the great assembly;

poetryblock.poem: I will exalt you among many people.

poem.verse: 19Do not let my deceitful enemies rejoice over me;

poetryblock.poem: do not let those who hate me without cause
wink at me maliciously.

poem.verse: 20For they do not speak in friendly ways,

poetryblock.poem: but contrive fraudulent schemes
against those who live peacefully in the land.

poem.verse: 21They open their mouths wide against me and say,

poetryblock.poem: ‘Aha, aha! We saw it! ’

poem.verse: 22You saw it, Lord; do not be silent.

poetryblock.poem: Lord, do not be far from me.

poem.verse: 23Wake up and rise to my defence,

poetryblock.poem: to my cause, my God and my Lord!

poem.verse: 24Vindicate me, Lord my God,

poetryblock.poem: in keeping with your righteousness,
and do not let them rejoice over me.

poem.verse: 25Do not let them say in their hearts,

poetryblock.poem: ‘Aha! Just what we wanted.’
Do not let them say,
‘We have swallowed him up! ’

poem.verse: 26Let those who rejoice at my misfortune

poetryblock.poem: be disgraced and humiliated;
let those who exalt themselves over me
be clothed with shame and reproach.

poem.verse: 27Let those who want my vindication

poetryblock.poem: shout for joy and be glad;
let them continually say,
‘The Lord be exalted.
He takes pleasure in his servant’s well-being.’

poem.verse: 28And my tongue will proclaim your righteousness,

poetryblock.poem: your praise all day long.

chapter.head2: For the choir director. Of David, the Lord’s servant.

poem.verse: 1An oracle within my heart

poetryblock.poem: concerning the transgression of the wicked person:
Dread of God has no effect on him.

poem.verse: 2For with his flattering opinion of himself,

poetryblock.poem: he does not discover and hate his iniquity.

poem.verse: 3The words from his mouth are malicious and deceptive;

poetryblock.poem: he has stopped acting wisely and doing good.

poem.verse: 4Even on his bed he makes malicious plans.

poetryblock.poem: He sets himself on a path that is not good,
and he does not reject evil.

poem.verse: 5Lord, your faithful love reaches to heaven,

poetryblock.poem: your faithfulness to the clouds.

poem.verse: 6Your righteousness is like the highest mountains,

poetryblock.poem: your judgements like the deepest sea.
Lord, you preserve people and animals.

poem.verse: 7How priceless your faithful love is, God!

poetryblock.poem: People take refuge in the shadow of your wings.

poem.verse: 8They are filled from the abundance of your house.

poetryblock.poem: You let them drink from your refreshing stream.

poem.verse: 9For the wellspring of life is with you.

poetryblock.poem: By means of your light we see light.

poem.verse: 10Spread your faithful love over those who know you,

poetryblock.poem: and your righteousness over the upright in heart.

poem.verse: 11Do not let the foot of the arrogant come near me

poetryblock.poem: or the hand of the wicked drive me away.

poem.verse: 12There! The evildoers have fallen.

poetryblock.poem: They have been thrown down and cannot rise.

chapter.head2: Of David.

poem.verse: 1Do not be agitated by evildoers;

poetryblock.poem: do not envy those who do wrong.

poem.verse: 2For they wither quickly like grass

poetryblock.poem: and wilt like tender green plants.

poem.verse: 3Trust in the Lord and do what is good;

poetryblock.poem: dwell in the land and live securely.

poem.verse: 4Take delight in the Lord,

poetryblock.poem: and he will give you your heart’s desires.

poem.verse: 5Commit your way to the Lord;

poetryblock.poem: trust in him, and he will act,

poem.verse: 6making your righteousness shine like the dawn,

poetryblock.poem: your justice like the noonday.

poem.verse: 7Be silent before the Lord and wait expectantly for him;

poetryblock.poem: do not be agitated by one who prospers in his way,
by the person who carries out evil plans.

poem.verse: 8Refrain from anger and give up your rage;

poetryblock.poem: do not be agitated ​– ​it can only bring harm.

poem.verse: 9For evildoers will be destroyed,

poetryblock.poem: but those who put their hope in the Lord
will inherit the land.

poem.verse: 10A little while, and the wicked person will be no more;

poetryblock.poem: though you look for him, he will not be there.

poem.verse: 11But the humble will inherit the land

poetryblock.poem: and will enjoy abundant prosperity.

poem.verse: 12The wicked person schemes against the righteous

poetryblock.poem: and gnashes his teeth at him.

poem.verse: 13The Lord laughs at him

poetryblock.poem: because he sees that his day is coming.

poem.verse: 14The wicked have drawn the sword and strung the bow

poetryblock.poem: to bring down the poor and needy
and to slaughter those whose way is upright.

poem.verse: 15Their swords will enter their own hearts,

poetryblock.poem: and their bows will be broken.

poem.verse: 16The little that the righteous person has is better

poetryblock.poem: than the abundance of many wicked people.

poem.verse: 17For the arms of the wicked will be broken,

poetryblock.poem: but the Lord supports the righteous.

poem.verse: 18The Lord watches over the blameless all their days,

poetryblock.poem: and their inheritance will last for ever.

poem.verse: 19They will not be disgraced in times of adversity;

poetryblock.poem: they will be satisfied in days of hunger.

poem.verse: 20But the wicked will perish;

poetryblock.poem: the Lord’s enemies, like the glory of the pastures,
will fade away –
they will fade away like smoke.

poem.verse: 21The wicked person borrows and does not repay,

poetryblock.poem: but the righteous one is gracious and giving.

poem.verse: 22Those who are blessed by the Lord will inherit the land,

poetryblock.poem: but those cursed by him will be destroyed.

poem.verse: 23A person’s steps are established by the Lord,

poetryblock.poem: and he takes pleasure in his way.

poem.verse: 24Though he falls, he will not be overwhelmed,

poetryblock.poem: because the Lord supports him with his hand.

poem.verse: 25I have been young and now I am old,

poetryblock.poem: yet I have not seen the righteous abandoned
or his children begging for bread.

poem.verse: 26He is always generous, always lending,

poetryblock.poem: and his children are a blessing.

poem.verse: 27Turn away from evil, do what is good,

poetryblock.poem: and settle permanently.

poem.verse: 28For the Lord loves justice

poetryblock.poem: and will not abandon his faithful ones.
They are kept safe for ever,
but the children of the wicked will be destroyed.

poem.verse: 29The righteous will inherit the land

poetryblock.poem: and dwell in it permanently.

poem.verse: 30The mouth of the righteous utters wisdom;

poetryblock.poem: his tongue speaks what is just.

poem.verse: 31The instruction of his God is in his heart;

poetryblock.poem: his steps do not falter.

poem.verse: 32The wicked one lies in wait for the righteous

poetryblock.poem: and intends to kill him;

poem.verse: 33the Lord will not leave him

poetryblock.poem: in the power of the wicked one
or allow him to be condemned when he is judged.

poem.verse: 34Wait for the Lord and keep his way,

poetryblock.poem: and he will exalt you to inherit the land.
You will watch when the wicked are destroyed.

poem.verse: 35I have seen a wicked, violent person

poetryblock.poem: well-rooted, like a flourishing native tree.

poem.verse: 36Then I passed by and noticed he was gone;

poetryblock.poem: I searched for him, but he could not be found.

poem.verse: 37Watch the blameless and observe the upright,

poetryblock.poem: for the person of peace will have a future.

poem.verse: 38But transgressors will all be eliminated;

poetryblock.poem: the future of the wicked will be destroyed.

poem.verse: 39The salvation of the righteous is from the Lord,

poetryblock.poem: their refuge in a time of distress.

poem.verse: 40The Lord helps and delivers them;

poetryblock.poem: he will deliver them from the wicked and will save them
because they take refuge in him.

chapter.head2: A psalm of David to bring remembrance.

poem.verse: 1Lord, do not punish me in your anger

poetryblock.poem: or discipline me in your wrath.

poem.verse: 2For your arrows have sunk into me,

poetryblock.poem: and your hand has pressed down on me.

poem.verse: 3There is no soundness in my body

poetryblock.poem: because of your indignation;
there is no health in my bones
because of my sin.

poem.verse: 4For my iniquities have flooded over my head;

poetryblock.poem: they are a burden too heavy for me to bear.

poem.verse: 5My wounds are foul and festering

poetryblock.poem: because of my foolishness.

poem.verse: 6I am bent over and brought very low;

poetryblock.poem: all day long I go around in mourning.

poem.verse: 7For my insides are full of burning pain,

poetryblock.poem: and there is no soundness in my body.

poem.verse: 8I am faint and severely crushed;

poetryblock.poem: I groan because of the anguish of my heart.

poem.verse: 9Lord, my every desire is in front of you;

poetryblock.poem: my sighing is not hidden from you.

poem.verse: 10My heart races, my strength leaves me,

poetryblock.poem: and even the light of my eyes has faded.

poem.verse: 11My loved ones and friends stand back from my affliction,

poetryblock.poem: and my relatives stand at a distance.

poem.verse: 12Those who intend to kill me set traps,

poetryblock.poem: and those who want to harm me threaten to destroy me;
they plot treachery all day long.

poem.verse: 13I am like a deaf person; I do not hear.

poetryblock.poem: I am like a speechless person
who does not open his mouth.

poem.verse: 14I am like a man who does not hear

poetryblock.poem: and has no arguments in his mouth.

poem.verse: 15For I put my hope in you, Lord;

poetryblock.poem: you will answer me, my Lord, my God.

poem.verse: 16For I said, ‘Don’t let them rejoice over me –

poetryblock.poem: those who are arrogant towards me when I stumble.’

poem.verse: 17For I am about to fall,

poetryblock.poem: and my pain is constantly with me.

poem.verse: 18So I confess my iniquity;

poetryblock.poem: I am anxious because of my sin.

poem.verse: 19But my enemies are vigorous and powerful;

poetryblock.poem: many hate me for no reason.

poem.verse: 20Those who repay evil for good

poetryblock.poem: attack me for pursuing good.

poem.verse: 21Lord, do not abandon me;

poetryblock.poem: my God, do not be far from me.

poem.verse: 22Hurry to help me,

poetryblock.poem: my Lord, my salvation.

chapter.head2: For the choir director, for Jeduthun. A psalm of David.

poem.verse: 1I said, ‘I will guard my ways

poetryblock.poem: so that I may not sin with my tongue;
I will guard my mouth with a muzzle
as long as the wicked are in my presence.’

poem.verse: 2I was speechless and quiet;

poetryblock.poem: I kept silent, even from speaking good,
and my pain intensified.

poem.verse: 3My heart grew hot within me;

poetryblock.poem: as I mused, a fire burned.
I spoke with my tongue:

poem.verse: 4‘Lord, make me aware of my end

poetryblock.poem: and the number of my days
so that I will know how short-lived I am.

poem.verse: 5In fact, you have made my days just handbreadths long,

poetryblock.poem: and my lifespan is as nothing to you.
Yes, every human being stands as only a vapour.'Selah'

poem.verse: 6Yes, a person goes about like a mere shadow.

poetryblock.poem: Indeed, they rush around in vain,
gathering possessions
without knowing who will get them.

poem.verse: 7‘Now, Lord, what do I wait for?

poetryblock.poem: My hope is in you.

poem.verse: 8Rescue me from all my transgressions;

poetryblock.poem: do not make me the taunt of fools.

poem.verse: 9I am speechless; I do not open my mouth

poetryblock.poem: because of what you have done.

poem.verse: 10Remove your torment from me.

poetryblock.poem: Because of the force of your hand I am finished.

poem.verse: 11You discipline a person with punishment for iniquity,

poetryblock.poem: consuming like a moth what is precious to him;
yes, every human being is only a vapour.'Selah'

poem.verse: 12‘Hear my prayer, Lord,

poetryblock.poem: and listen to my cry for help;
do not be silent at my tears.
For I am here with you as a foreigner,
a temporary resident like all my ancestors.

poem.verse: 13Turn your angry gaze from me

poetryblock.poem: so that I may be cheered up
before I die and am gone.’

chapter.head1: Thanksgiving and a Cry for Help
chapter.head2: For the choir director. A psalm of David.

poem.verse: 1I waited patiently for the Lord,

poetryblock.poem: and he turned to me and heard my cry for help.

poem.verse: 2He brought me up from a desolate pit,

poetryblock.poem: out of the muddy clay,
and set my feet on a rock,
making my steps secure.

poem.verse: 3He put a new song in my mouth,

poetryblock.poem: a hymn of praise to our God.
Many will see and fear,
and they will trust in the Lord.

poem.verse: 4How happy is anyone

poetryblock.poem: who has put his trust in the Lord
and has not turned to the proud
or to those who run after lies!

poem.verse: 5Lord my God, you have done many things –

poetryblock.poem: your wondrous works and your plans for us;
none can compare with you.
If I were to report and speak of them,
they are more than can be told.

poem.verse: 6You do not delight in sacrifice and offering;

poetryblock.poem: you open my ears to listen.
You do not ask for a whole burnt offering or a sin offering.

poem.verse: 7Then I said, ‘See, I have come;

poetryblock.poem: in the scroll it is written about me.

poem.verse: 8I delight to do your will, my God,

poetryblock.poem: and your instruction is deep within me.’

poem.verse: 9I proclaim righteousness in the great assembly;

poetryblock.poem: see, I do not keep my mouth closed –
as you know, Lord.

poem.verse: 10I did not hide your righteousness in my heart;

poetryblock.poem: I spoke about your faithfulness and salvation;
I did not conceal your constant love and truth
from the great assembly.

poem.verse: 11Lord, you do not withhold your compassion from me.

poetryblock.poem: Your constant love and truth will always guard me.

poem.verse: 12For troubles without number have surrounded me;

poetryblock.poem: my iniquities have overtaken me; I am unable to see.
They are more than the hairs of my head,
and my courage leaves me.

poem.verse: 13Lord, be pleased to rescue me;

poetryblock.poem: hurry to help me, Lord.

poem.verse: 14Let those who intend to take my life

poetryblock.poem: be disgraced and confounded.
Let those who wish me harm
be turned back and humiliated.

poem.verse: 15Let those who say to me, ‘Aha, aha! ’

poetryblock.poem: be appalled because of their shame.

poem.verse: 16Let all who seek you rejoice and be glad in you;

poetryblock.poem: let those who love your salvation continually say,
‘The Lord is great! ’

poem.verse: 17I am oppressed and needy;

poetryblock.poem: may the Lord think of me.
You are my helper and my deliverer;
my God, do not delay.

chapter.head2: For the choir director. A psalm of David.

poem.verse: 1Happy is one who is considerate of the poor;

poetryblock.poem: the Lord will save him in a day of adversity.

poem.verse: 2The Lord will keep him and preserve him;

poetryblock.poem: he will be blessed in the land.
You will not give him over to the desire of his enemies.

poem.verse: 3The Lord will sustain him on his sick-bed;

poetryblock.poem: you will heal him on the bed where he lies.

poem.verse: 4I said, ‘Lord, be gracious to me;

poetryblock.poem: heal me, for I have sinned against you.’

poem.verse: 5My enemies speak maliciously about me:

poetryblock.poem: ‘When will he die and be forgotten? ’

poem.verse: 6When one of them comes to visit, he speaks deceitfully;

poetryblock.poem: he stores up evil in his heart;
he goes out and talks.

poem.verse: 7All who hate me whisper together about me;

poetryblock.poem: they plan to harm me.

poem.verse: 8‘Something awful has overwhelmed him,

poetryblock.poem: and he won’t rise again from where he lies! ’

poem.verse: 9Even my friend in whom I trusted,

poetryblock.poem: one who ate my bread,
has raised his heel against me.

poem.verse: 10But you, Lord, be gracious to me and raise me up;

poetryblock.poem: then I will repay them.

poem.verse: 11By this I know that you delight in me:

poetryblock.poem: my enemy does not shout in triumph over me.

poem.verse: 12You supported me because of my integrity

poetryblock.poem: and set me in your presence for ever.

poem.verse: 13Blessed be the Lord God of Israel,

poetryblock.poem: from everlasting to everlasting.
Amen and amen.

chapter.head2: For the choir director. A 'Maskil' of the sons of Korah.

poem.verse: 1As a deer longs for flowing streams,

poetryblock.poem: so I long for you, God.

poem.verse: 2I thirst for God, the living God.

poetryblock.poem: When can I come and appear before God?

poem.verse: 3My tears have been my food day and night,

poetryblock.poem: while all day long people say to me,
‘Where is your God? ’

poem.verse: 4I remember this as I pour out my heart:

poetryblock.poem: how I walked with many,
leading the festive procession to the house of God,
with joyful and thankful shouts.

poem.verse: 5Why, my soul, are you so dejected?

poetryblock.poem: Why are you in such turmoil?
Put your hope in God, for I will still praise him,
my Saviour and my God.

poem.verse: 6I am deeply depressed;

poetryblock.poem: therefore I remember you from the land of Jordan
and the peaks of Hermon, from Mount Mizar.

poem.verse: 7Deep calls to deep in the roar of your waterfalls;

poetryblock.poem: all your breakers and your billows have swept over me.

poem.verse: 8The Lord will send his faithful love by day;

poetryblock.poem: his song will be with me in the night –
a prayer to the God of my life.
