poetryblock.poem: I will enter through them
and give thanks to the Lord.

poem.verse: 20This is the Lord’s gate;

poetryblock.poem: the righteous will enter through it.

poem.verse: 21I will give thanks to you

poetryblock.poem: because you have answered me
and have become my salvation.

poem.verse: 22The stone that the builders rejected

poetryblock.poem: has become the cornerstone.

poem.verse: 23This came from the Lord;

poetryblock.poem: it is wondrous in our sight.

poem.verse: 24This is the day the Lord has made;

poetryblock.poem: let’s rejoice and be glad in it.

poem.verse: 25Lord, save us!

poetryblock.poem: Lord, please grant us success!

poem.verse: 26He who comes in the name

poetryblock.poem: of the Lord is blessed.
From the house of the Lord we bless you.

poem.verse: 27The Lord is God and has given us light.

poetryblock.poem: Bind the festival sacrifice with cords
to the horns of the altar.

poem.verse: 28You are my God, and I will give you thanks.

poetryblock.poem: You are my God; I will exalt you.

poem.verse: 29Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good;

poetryblock.poem: his faithful love endures for ever.

poem.verse: 1How happy are those whose way is blameless,

poetryblock.poem: who walk according to the Lord’s instruction!

poem.verse: 2Happy are those who keep his decrees

poetryblock.poem: and seek him with all their heart.

poem.verse: 3They do nothing wrong;

poetryblock.poem: they walk in his ways.

poem.verse: 4You have commanded that your precepts

poetryblock.poem: be diligently kept.

poem.verse: 5If only my ways were committed

poetryblock.poem: to keeping your statutes!

poem.verse: 6Then I would not be ashamed

poetryblock.poem: when I think about all your commands.

poem.verse: 7I will praise you with an upright heart

poetryblock.poem: when I learn your righteous judgements.

poem.verse: 8I will keep your statutes;

poetryblock.poem: never abandon me.

poem.verse: 9How can a young man keep his way pure?

poetryblock.poem: By keeping your word.

poem.verse: 10I have sought you with all my heart;

poetryblock.poem: don’t let me wander from your commands.

poem.verse: 11I have treasured your word in my heart

poetryblock.poem: so that I may not sin against you.

poem.verse: 12Lord, may you be blessed;

poetryblock.poem: teach me your statutes.

poem.verse: 13With my lips I proclaim

poetryblock.poem: all the judgements from your mouth.

poem.verse: 14I rejoice in the way revealed by your decrees

poetryblock.poem: as much as in all riches.

poem.verse: 15I will meditate on your precepts

poetryblock.poem: and think about your ways.

poem.verse: 16I will delight in your statutes;

poetryblock.poem: I will not forget your word.

poem.verse: 17Deal generously with your servant

poetryblock.poem: so that I might live;
then I will keep your word.

poem.verse: 18Open my eyes so that I may contemplate

poetryblock.poem: wondrous things from your instruction.

poem.verse: 19I am a resident foreigner on earth;

poetryblock.poem: do not hide your commands from me.

poem.verse: 20I am continually overcome

poetryblock.poem: with longing for your judgements.

poem.verse: 21You rebuke the arrogant,

poetryblock.poem: the ones under a curse,
who wander from your commands.

poem.verse: 22Take insult and contempt away from me,

poetryblock.poem: for I have kept your decrees.

poem.verse: 23Though princes sit together speaking against me,

poetryblock.poem: your servant will think about your statutes;

poem.verse: 24your decrees are my delight

poetryblock.poem: and my counsellors.

poem.verse: 25My life is down in the dust;

poetryblock.poem: give me life through your word.

poem.verse: 26I told you about my life,

poetryblock.poem: and you answered me;
teach me your statutes.

poem.verse: 27Help me understand

poetryblock.poem: the meaning of your precepts
so that I can meditate on your wonders.

poem.verse: 28I am weary from grief;

poetryblock.poem: strengthen me through your word.

poem.verse: 29Keep me from the way of deceit

poetryblock.poem: and graciously give me your instruction.

poem.verse: 30I have chosen the way of truth;

poetryblock.poem: I have set your ordinances before me.

poem.verse: 31I cling to your decrees;

poetryblock.poem: Lord, do not put me to shame.

poem.verse: 32I pursue the way of your commands,

poetryblock.poem: for you broaden my understanding.

poem.verse: 33Teach me, Lord, the meaning of your statutes,

poetryblock.poem: and I will always keep them.

poem.verse: 34Help me understand your instruction,

poetryblock.poem: and I will obey it
and follow it with all my heart.

poem.verse: 35Help me stay on the path of your commands,

poetryblock.poem: for I take pleasure in it.

poem.verse: 36Turn my heart to your decrees

poetryblock.poem: and not to dishonest profit.

poem.verse: 37Turn my eyes

poetryblock.poem: from looking at what is worthless;
give me life in your ways.

poem.verse: 38Confirm what you said to your servant,

poetryblock.poem: for it produces reverence for you.

poem.verse: 39Turn away the disgrace I dread;

poetryblock.poem: indeed, your judgements are good.

poem.verse: 40How I long for your precepts!

poetryblock.poem: Give me life through your righteousness.

poem.verse: 41Let your faithful love come to me, Lord,

poetryblock.poem: your salvation, as you promised.

poem.verse: 42Then I can answer the one who taunts me,

poetryblock.poem: for I trust in your word.

poem.verse: 43Never take the word of truth from my mouth,

poetryblock.poem: for I hope in your judgements.

poem.verse: 44I will always obey your instruction,

poetryblock.poem: for ever and ever.

poem.verse: 45I will walk freely in an open place

poetryblock.poem: because I study your precepts.

poem.verse: 46I will speak of your decrees before kings

poetryblock.poem: and not be ashamed.

poem.verse: 47I delight in your commands,

poetryblock.poem: which I love.

poem.verse: 48I will lift up my hands to your commands,

poetryblock.poem: which I love,
and will meditate on your statutes.

poem.verse: 49Remember your word to your servant;

poetryblock.poem: you have given me hope through it.

poem.verse: 50This is my comfort in my affliction:

poetryblock.poem: Your promise has given me life.

poem.verse: 51The arrogant constantly ridicule me,

poetryblock.poem: but I do not turn away from your instruction.

poem.verse: 52Lord, I remember your judgements from long ago

poetryblock.poem: and find comfort.

poem.verse: 53Fury seizes me because of the wicked

poetryblock.poem: who reject your instruction.

poem.verse: 54Your statutes are the theme of my song

poetryblock.poem: during my earthly life.

poem.verse: 55Lord, I remember your name in the night,

poetryblock.poem: and I obey your instruction.

poem.verse: 56This is my practice:

poetryblock.poem: I obey your precepts.

poem.verse: 57The Lord is my portion;

poetryblock.poem: I have promised to keep your words.

poem.verse: 58I have sought your favour with all my heart;

poetryblock.poem: be gracious to me according to your promise.

poem.verse: 59I thought about my ways

poetryblock.poem: and turned my steps back to your decrees.

poem.verse: 60I hurried, not hesitating

poetryblock.poem: to keep your commands.

poem.verse: 61Though the ropes of the wicked

poetryblock.poem: were wrapped round me,
I did not forget your instruction.

poem.verse: 62I rise at midnight to thank you

poetryblock.poem: for your righteous judgements.

poem.verse: 63I am a friend to all who fear you,

poetryblock.poem: to those who keep your precepts.

poem.verse: 64Lord, the earth is filled with your faithful love;

poetryblock.poem: teach me your statutes.

poem.verse: 65Lord, you have treated your servant well,

poetryblock.poem: just as you promised.

poem.verse: 66Teach me good judgement and discernment,

poetryblock.poem: for I rely on your commands.

poem.verse: 67Before I was afflicted I went astray,

poetryblock.poem: but now I keep your word.

poem.verse: 68You are good, and you do what is good;

poetryblock.poem: teach me your statutes.

poem.verse: 69The arrogant have smeared me with lies,

poetryblock.poem: but I obey your precepts with all my heart.

poem.verse: 70Their hearts are hard and insensitive,

poetryblock.poem: but I delight in your instruction.

poem.verse: 71It was good for me to be afflicted

poetryblock.poem: so that I could learn your statutes.

poem.verse: 72Instruction from your lips is better for me

poetryblock.poem: than thousands of gold and silver pieces.

poem.verse: 73Your hands made me and formed me;

poetryblock.poem: give me understanding
so that I can learn your commands.

poem.verse: 74Those who fear you will see me and rejoice,

poetryblock.poem: for I put my hope in your word.

poem.verse: 75I know, Lord, that your judgements are just

poetryblock.poem: and that you have afflicted me fairly.

poem.verse: 76May your faithful love comfort me

poetryblock.poem: as you promised your servant.

poem.verse: 77May your compassion come to me

poetryblock.poem: so that I may live,
for your instruction is my delight.

poem.verse: 78Let the arrogant be put to shame

poetryblock.poem: for slandering me with lies;
I will meditate on your precepts.

poem.verse: 79Let those who fear you,

poetryblock.poem: those who know your decrees, turn to me.

poem.verse: 80May my heart be blameless regarding your statutes

poetryblock.poem: so that I will not be put to shame.

poem.verse: 81I long for your salvation;

poetryblock.poem: I put my hope in your word.

poem.verse: 82My eyes grow weary

poetryblock.poem: looking for what you have promised;
I ask, ‘When will you comfort me? ’

poem.verse: 83Though I have become like a wineskin dried by smoke,

poetryblock.poem: I do not forget your statutes.

poem.verse: 84How many days must your servant wait?

poetryblock.poem: When will you execute judgement on my persecutors?

poem.verse: 85The arrogant have dug pits for me;

poetryblock.poem: they violate your instruction.

poem.verse: 86All your commands are true;

poetryblock.poem: people persecute me with lies ​– ​help me!

poem.verse: 87They almost ended my life on earth,

poetryblock.poem: but I did not abandon your precepts.

poem.verse: 88Give me life in accordance with your faithful love,

poetryblock.poem: and I will obey the decree you have spoken.

poem.verse: 89Lord, your word is for ever;

poetryblock.poem: it is firmly fixed in heaven.

poem.verse: 90Your faithfulness is for all generations;

poetryblock.poem: you established the earth, and it stands firm.

poem.verse: 91Your judgements stand firm today,

poetryblock.poem: for all things are your servants.

poem.verse: 92If your instruction had not been my delight,

poetryblock.poem: I would have died in my affliction.

poem.verse: 93I will never forget your precepts,

poetryblock.poem: for you have given me life through them.

poem.verse: 94I am yours; save me,

poetryblock.poem: for I have studied your precepts.

poem.verse: 95The wicked hope to destroy me,

poetryblock.poem: but I contemplate your decrees.

poem.verse: 96I have seen a limit to all perfection,

poetryblock.poem: but your command is without limit.

poem.verse: 97How I love your instruction!

poetryblock.poem: It is my meditation all day long.

poem.verse: 98Your command makes me wiser than my enemies,

poetryblock.poem: for it is always with me.

poem.verse: 99I have more insight than all my teachers

poetryblock.poem: because your decrees are my meditation.

poem.verse: 100I understand more than the elders

poetryblock.poem: because I obey your precepts.

poem.verse: 101I have kept my feet from every evil path

poetryblock.poem: to follow your word.

poem.verse: 102I have not turned from your judgements,

poetryblock.poem: for you yourself have instructed me.

poem.verse: 103How sweet your word is to my taste –

poetryblock.poem: sweeter than honey in my mouth.

poem.verse: 104I gain understanding from your precepts;

poetryblock.poem: therefore I hate every false way.

poem.verse: 105Your word is a lamp for my feet

poetryblock.poem: and a light on my path.

poem.verse: 106I have solemnly sworn

poetryblock.poem: to keep your righteous judgements.

poem.verse: 107I am severely afflicted;

poetryblock.poem: Lord, give me life according to your word.

poem.verse: 108Lord, please accept my freewill offerings of praise,

poetryblock.poem: and teach me your judgements.

poem.verse: 109My life is constantly in danger,

poetryblock.poem: yet I do not forget your instruction.

poem.verse: 110The wicked have set a trap for me,

poetryblock.poem: but I have not wandered from your precepts.

poem.verse: 111I have your decrees as a heritage for ever;

poetryblock.poem: indeed, they are the joy of my heart.

poem.verse: 112I am resolved to obey your statutes

poetryblock.poem: to the very end.

poem.verse: 113I hate those who are double-minded,

poetryblock.poem: but I love your instruction.

poem.verse: 114You are my shelter and my shield;

poetryblock.poem: I put my hope in your word.

poem.verse: 115Depart from me, you evil ones,

poetryblock.poem: so that I may obey my God’s commands.

poem.verse: 116Sustain me as you promised, and I will live;

poetryblock.poem: do not let me be ashamed of my hope.

poem.verse: 117Sustain me so that I can be safe

poetryblock.poem: and always be concerned about your statutes.

poem.verse: 118You reject all who stray from your statutes,

poetryblock.poem: for their deceit is a lie.

poem.verse: 119You remove all the wicked on earth

poetryblock.poem: as if they were dross from metal;
therefore, I love your decrees.

poem.verse: 120I tremble in awe of you;

poetryblock.poem: I fear your judgements.

poem.verse: 121I have done what is just and right;

poetryblock.poem: do not leave me to my oppressors.

poem.verse: 122Guarantee your servant’s well-being;

poetryblock.poem: do not let the arrogant oppress me.

poem.verse: 123My eyes grow weary looking for your salvation

poetryblock.poem: and for your righteous promise.

poem.verse: 124Deal with your servant based on your faithful love;

poetryblock.poem: teach me your statutes.

poem.verse: 125I am your servant; give me understanding

poetryblock.poem: so that I may know your decrees.

poem.verse: 126It is time for the Lord to act,

poetryblock.poem: for they have violated your instruction.

poem.verse: 127Since I love your commands

poetryblock.poem: more than gold, even the purest gold,

poem.verse: 128I carefully follow all your precepts

poetryblock.poem: and hate every false way.

poem.verse: 129Your decrees are wondrous;

poetryblock.poem: therefore I obey them.

poem.verse: 130The revelation of your words brings light

poetryblock.poem: and gives understanding to the inexperienced.

poem.verse: 131I open my mouth and pant

poetryblock.poem: because I long for your commands.

poem.verse: 132Turn to me and be gracious to me,

poetryblock.poem: as is your practise towards those who love your name.

poem.verse: 133Make my steps steady through your promise;

poetryblock.poem: don’t let any sin dominate me.

poem.verse: 134Redeem me from human oppression,

poetryblock.poem: and I will keep your precepts.

poem.verse: 135Make your face shine on your servant,

poetryblock.poem: and teach me your statutes.

poem.verse: 136My eyes pour out streams of tears

poetryblock.poem: because people do not follow your instruction.

poem.verse: 137You are righteous, Lord,

poetryblock.poem: and your judgements are just.

poem.verse: 138The decrees you issue are righteous

poetryblock.poem: and altogether trustworthy.

poem.verse: 139My anger overwhelms me

poetryblock.poem: because my foes forget your words.

poem.verse: 140Your word is completely pure,

poetryblock.poem: and your servant loves it.

poem.verse: 141I am insignificant and despised,

poetryblock.poem: but I do not forget your precepts.

poem.verse: 142Your righteousness is an everlasting righteousness,

poetryblock.poem: and your instruction is true.

poem.verse: 143Trouble and distress have overtaken me,

poetryblock.poem: but your commands are my delight.

poem.verse: 144Your decrees are righteous for ever.

poetryblock.poem: Give me understanding, and I will live.

poem.verse: 145I call with all my heart; answer me, Lord.

poetryblock.poem: I will obey your statutes.

poem.verse: 146I call to you; save me,

poetryblock.poem: and I will keep your decrees.

poem.verse: 147I rise before dawn and cry out for help;

poetryblock.poem: I put my hope in your word.

poem.verse: 148I am awake through each watch of the night

poetryblock.poem: to meditate on your promise.

poem.verse: 149In keeping with your faithful love, hear my voice.

poetryblock.poem: Lord, give me life in keeping with your justice.

poem.verse: 150Those who pursue evil plans come near;

poetryblock.poem: they are far from your instruction.

poem.verse: 151You are near, Lord,

poetryblock.poem: and all your commands are true.

poem.verse: 152Long ago I learned from your decrees

poetryblock.poem: that you have established them for ever.

poem.verse: 153Consider my affliction and rescue me,

poetryblock.poem: for I have not forgotten your instruction.

poem.verse: 154Champion my cause and redeem me;

poetryblock.poem: give me life as you promised.

poem.verse: 155Salvation is far from the wicked

poetryblock.poem: because they do not study your statutes.

poem.verse: 156Your compassions are many, Lord;

poetryblock.poem: give me life according to your judgements.

poem.verse: 157My persecutors and foes are many.

poetryblock.poem: I have not turned from your decrees.

poem.verse: 158I have seen the disloyal and feel disgust

poetryblock.poem: because they do not keep your word.

poem.verse: 159Consider how I love your precepts;

poetryblock.poem: Lord, give me life according to your faithful love.

poem.verse: 160The entirety of your word is truth,

poetryblock.poem: each of your righteous judgements endures for ever.

poem.verse: 161Princes have persecuted me without cause,

poetryblock.poem: but my heart fears only your word.

poem.verse: 162I rejoice over your promise

poetryblock.poem: like one who finds vast treasure.

poem.verse: 163I hate and abhor falsehood,

poetryblock.poem: but I love your instruction.

poem.verse: 164I praise you seven times a day

poetryblock.poem: for your righteous judgements.

poem.verse: 165Abundant peace belongs to those

poetryblock.poem: who love your instruction;
nothing makes them stumble.

poem.verse: 166Lord, I hope for your salvation

poetryblock.poem: and carry out your commands.

poem.verse: 167I obey your decrees

poetryblock.poem: and love them greatly.

poem.verse: 168I obey your precepts and decrees,

poetryblock.poem: for all my ways are before you.

poem.verse: 169Let my cry reach you, Lord;

poetryblock.poem: give me understanding according to your word.

poem.verse: 170Let my plea reach you;

poetryblock.poem: rescue me according to your promise.

poem.verse: 171My lips pour out praise,

poetryblock.poem: for you teach me your statutes.

poem.verse: 172My tongue sings about your promise,

poetryblock.poem: for all your commands are righteous.

poem.verse: 173May your hand be ready to help me,

poetryblock.poem: for I have chosen your precepts.

poem.verse: 174I long for your salvation, Lord,

poetryblock.poem: and your instruction is my delight.

poem.verse: 175Let me live, and I will praise you;

poetryblock.poem: may your judgements help me.

poem.verse: 176I wander like a lost sheep;

poetryblock.poem: seek your servant,
for I do not forget your commands.

chapter.head1: A Cry for Truth and Peace
chapter.head2: A song of ascents.

poem.verse: 1In my distress I called to the Lord,

poetryblock.poem: and he answered me.

poem.verse: 2‘Lord, rescue me from lying lips

poetryblock.poem: and a deceitful tongue.’

poem.verse: 3What will he give you,

poetryblock.poem: and what will he do to you,
you deceitful tongue?

poem.verse: 4A warrior’s sharp arrows

poetryblock.poem: with burning charcoal!

poem.verse: 5What misery that I have stayed in Meshech,

poetryblock.poem: that I have lived among the tents of Kedar!

poem.verse: 6I have dwelt too long

poetryblock.poem: with those who hate peace.

poem.verse: 7I am for peace; but when I speak,

poetryblock.poem: they are for war.

chapter.head2: A song of ascents.

poem.verse: 1I lift my eyes towards the mountains.

poetryblock.poem: Where will my help come from?

poem.verse: 2My help comes from the Lord,

poetryblock.poem: the Maker of heaven and earth.

poem.verse: 3He will not allow your foot to slip;

poetryblock.poem: your Protector will not slumber.

poem.verse: 4Indeed, the Protector of Israel

poetryblock.poem: does not slumber or sleep.

poem.verse: 5The Lord protects you;

poetryblock.poem: the Lord is a shelter right by your side.

poem.verse: 6The sun will not strike you by day

poetryblock.poem: or the moon by night.

poem.verse: 7The Lord will protect you from all harm;

poetryblock.poem: he will protect your life.

poem.verse: 8The Lord will protect your coming and going

poetryblock.poem: both now and for ever.

chapter.head2: A song of ascents. Of David.

poem.verse: 1I rejoiced with those who said to me,

poetryblock.poem: ‘Let’s go to the house of the Lord.’

poem.verse: 2Our feet were standing

poetryblock.poem: within your gates, Jerusalem –

poem.verse: 3Jerusalem, built as a city should be,

poetryblock.poem: solidly united,

poem.verse: 4where the tribes, the Lord’s tribes, go up

poetryblock.poem: to give thanks to the name of the Lord.
(This is an ordinance for Israel.)

poem.verse: 5There, thrones for judgement are placed,

poetryblock.poem: thrones of the house of David.

poem.verse: 6Pray for the well-being of Jerusalem:

poetryblock.poem: ‘May those who love you be secure;

poem.verse: 7may there be peace within your walls,

poetryblock.poem: security within your fortresses.’

poem.verse: 8Because of my brothers and friends,

poetryblock.poem: I will say, ‘May peace be in you.’

poem.verse: 9Because of the house of the Lord our God,

poetryblock.poem: I will pursue your prosperity.

chapter.head2: A song of ascents.

poem.verse: 1I lift my eyes to you,

poetryblock.poem: the one enthroned in heaven.

poem.verse: 2Like a servant’s eyes on his master’s hand,

poetryblock.poem: like a servant girl’s eyes on her mistress’s hand,
so our eyes are on the Lord our God
until he shows us favour.

poem.verse: 3Show us favour, Lord, show us favour,

poetryblock.poem: for we’ve had more than enough contempt.

poem.verse: 4We’ve had more than enough

poetryblock.poem: scorn from the arrogant
and contempt from the proud.

chapter.head1: The Lord Is on Our Side
chapter.head2: A song of ascents. Of David.

poem.verse: 1If the Lord had not been on our side –

poetryblock.poem: let Israel say –

poem.verse: 2if the Lord had not been on our side

poetryblock.poem: when people attacked us,

poem.verse: 3then they would have swallowed us alive

poetryblock.poem: in their burning anger against us.

poem.verse: 4Then the water would have engulfed us;

poetryblock.poem: the torrent would have swept over us;

poem.verse: 5the raging water would have swept over us.
6Blessed be the Lord,

poetryblock.poem: who has not let us be ripped apart by their teeth.

poem.verse: 7We have escaped like a bird from the hunter’s net;

poetryblock.poem: the net is torn, and we have escaped.

poem.verse: 8Our help is in the name of the Lord,

poetryblock.poem: the Maker of heaven and earth.

chapter.head2: A song of ascents.

poem.verse: 1Those who trust in the Lord are like Mount Zion.

poetryblock.poem: It cannot be shaken; it remains for ever.

poem.verse: 2The mountains surround Jerusalem

poetryblock.poem: and the Lord surrounds his people,
both now and for ever.

poem.verse: 3The sceptre of the wicked will not remain

poetryblock.poem: over the land allotted to the righteous,
so that the righteous will not apply their hands to injustice.

poem.verse: 4Do what is good, Lord, to the good,

poetryblock.poem: to those whose hearts are upright.

poem.verse: 5But as for those who turn aside to crooked ways,

poetryblock.poem: the Lord will banish them with the evildoers.
Peace be with Israel.

chapter.head2: A song of ascents.

poem.verse: 1When the Lord restored the fortunes of Zion,

poetryblock.poem: we were like those who dream.

poem.verse: 2Our mouths were filled with laughter then,

poetryblock.poem: and our tongues with shouts of joy.
Then they said among the nations,
‘The Lord has done great things for them.’

poem.verse: 3The Lord had done great things for us;

poetryblock.poem: we were joyful.

poem.verse: 4Restore our fortunes, Lord,

poetryblock.poem: like watercourses in the Negev.

poem.verse: 5Those who sow in tears

poetryblock.poem: will reap with shouts of joy.

poem.verse: 6Though one goes along weeping,

poetryblock.poem: carrying the bag of seed,
he will surely come back with shouts of joy,
carrying his sheaves.

chapter.head2: A song of ascents. Of Solomon.

poem.verse: 1Unless the Lord builds a house,

poetryblock.poem: its builders labour over it in vain;
unless the Lord watches over a city,
the watchman stays alert in vain.

poem.verse: 2In vain you get up early and stay up late,

poetryblock.poem: working hard to have enough food ​– ​
yes, he gives sleep to the one he loves.

poem.verse: 3Sons are indeed a heritage from the Lord,

poetryblock.poem: offspring, a reward.

poem.verse: 4Like arrows in the hand of a warrior

poetryblock.poem: are the sons born in one’s youth.

poem.verse: 5Happy is the man who has filled his quiver with them.

poetryblock.poem: They will never be put to shame
when they speak with their enemies at the city gate.

chapter.head1: Blessings for Those Who Fear God
chapter.head2: A song of ascents.

poem.verse: 1How happy is everyone who fears the Lord,

poetryblock.poem: who walks in his ways!

poem.verse: 2You will surely eat

poetryblock.poem: what your hands have worked for.
You will be happy,
and it will go well for you.

poem.verse: 3Your wife will be like a fruitful vine

poetryblock.poem: within your house,
your children, like young olive trees
round your table.

poem.verse: 4In this very way

poetryblock.poem: the man who fears the Lord
will be blessed.

poem.verse: 5May the Lord bless you from Zion,

poetryblock.poem: so that you will see the prosperity of Jerusalem
all the days of your life

poem.verse: 6and will see your children’s children!

poetryblock.poem: Peace be with Israel.

chapter.head2: A song of ascents.

poem.verse: 1Since my youth they have often attacked me –

poetryblock.poem: let Israel say –

poem.verse: 2since my youth they have often attacked me,

poetryblock.poem: but they have not prevailed against me.

poem.verse: 3Ploughmen ploughed over my back;

poetryblock.poem: they made their furrows long.

poem.verse: 4The Lord is righteous;

poetryblock.poem: he has cut the ropes of the wicked.

poem.verse: 5Let all who hate Zion

poetryblock.poem: be driven back in disgrace.

poem.verse: 6Let them be like grass on the rooftops,

poetryblock.poem: which withers before it grows up

poem.verse: 7and can’t even fill the hands of the reaper

poetryblock.poem: or the arms of the one who binds sheaves.

poem.verse: 8Then none who pass by will say,

poetryblock.poem: ‘May the Lord’s blessing be on you.
We bless you in the name of the Lord.’

chapter.head2: A song of ascents.

poem.verse: 1Out of the depths I call to you, Lord!
2Lord, listen to my voice;

poetryblock.poem: let your ears be attentive
to my cry for help.

poem.verse: 3Lord, if you kept an account of iniquities,

poetryblock.poem: Lord, who could stand?

poem.verse: 4But with you there is forgiveness,

poetryblock.poem: so that you may be revered.

poem.verse: 5I wait for the Lord; I wait

poetryblock.poem: and put my hope in his word.

poem.verse: 6I wait for the Lord

poetryblock.poem: more than watchmen for the morning –
more than watchmen for the morning.

poem.verse: 7Israel, put your hope in the Lord.

poetryblock.poem: For there is faithful love with the Lord,
and with him is redemption in abundance.

poem.verse: 8And he will redeem Israel

poetryblock.poem: from all its iniquities.

chapter.head2: A song of ascents. Of David.

poem.verse: 1Lord, my heart is not proud;

poetryblock.poem: my eyes are not haughty.
I do not get involved with things
too great or too wondrous for me.

poem.verse: 2Instead, I have calmed and quietened my soul

poetryblock.poem: like a weaned child with its mother;
my soul is like a weaned child.

poem.verse: 3Israel, put your hope in the Lord,

poetryblock.poem: both now and for ever.

chapter.head2: A song of ascents.

poem.verse: 1Lord, remember David

poetryblock.poem: and all the hardships he endured,

poem.verse: 2and how he swore an oath to the Lord,

poetryblock.poem: making a vow to the Mighty One of Jacob:

poem.verse: 3‘I will not enter my house

poetryblock.poem: or get into my bed,

poem.verse: 4I will not allow my eyes to sleep

poetryblock.poem: or my eyelids to slumber

poem.verse: 5until I find a place for the Lord,

poetryblock.poem: a dwelling for the Mighty One of Jacob.’

poem.verse: 6We heard of the ark in Ephrathah;

poetryblock.poem: we found it in the fields of Jaar.

poem.verse: 7Let’s go to his dwelling place;

poetryblock.poem: let’s worship at his footstool.

poem.verse: 8Rise up, Lord, come to your resting place,

poetryblock.poem: you and your powerful ark.

poem.verse: 9May your priests be clothed with righteousness,

poetryblock.poem: and may your faithful people shout for joy.

poem.verse: 10For the sake of your servant David,

poetryblock.poem: do not reject your anointed one.

poem.verse: 11The Lord swore an oath to David,

poetryblock.poem: a promise he will not abandon:
‘I will set one of your offspring
on your throne.

poem.verse: 12If your sons keep my covenant

poetryblock.poem: and my decrees that I will teach them,
their sons will also sit on your throne for ever.’

poem.verse: 13For the Lord has chosen Zion;

poetryblock.poem: he has desired it for his home:

poem.verse: 14‘This is my resting place for ever;

poetryblock.poem: I will make my home here
because I have desired it.

poem.verse: 15I will abundantly bless its food;

poetryblock.poem: I will satisfy its needy with bread.

poem.verse: 16I will clothe its priests with salvation,

poetryblock.poem: and its faithful people will shout for joy.

poem.verse: 17There I will make a horn grow for David;

poetryblock.poem: I have prepared a lamp for my anointed one.

poem.verse: 18I will clothe his enemies with shame,

poetryblock.poem: but the crown he wears will be glorious.’

chapter.head2: A song of ascents. Of David.

poem.verse: 1How delightfully good

poetryblock.poem: when brothers live together in harmony!

poem.verse: 2It is like fine oil on the head,

poetryblock.poem: running down on the beard,
running down Aaron’s beard
onto his robes.

poem.verse: 3It is like the dew of Hermon

poetryblock.poem: falling on the mountains of Zion.
For there the Lord has appointed the blessing –
life for evermore.

chapter.head2: A song of ascents.

poem.verse: 1Now bless the Lord,

poetryblock.poem: all you servants of the Lord
who stand in the Lord’s house at night!

poem.verse: 2Lift up your hands in the holy place

poetryblock.poem: and bless the Lord!

poem.verse: 3May the Lord,

poetryblock.poem: Maker of heaven and earth,
bless you from Zion.

poem.verse: 1Hallelujah!

poetryblock.poem: Praise the name of the Lord.
Give praise, you servants of the Lord

poem.verse: 2who stand in the house of the Lord,

poetryblock.poem: in the courts of the house of our God.

poem.verse: 3Praise the Lord, for the Lord is good;

poetryblock.poem: sing praise to his name, for it is delightful.

poem.verse: 4For the Lord has chosen Jacob for himself,

poetryblock.poem: Israel as his treasured possession.

poem.verse: 5For I know that the Lord is great;

poetryblock.poem: our Lord is greater than all gods.

poem.verse: 6The Lord does whatever he pleases

poetryblock.poem: in heaven and on earth,
in the seas and all the depths.

poem.verse: 7He causes the clouds to rise from the ends of the earth.

poetryblock.poem: He makes lightning for the rain
and brings the wind from his storehouses.

poem.verse: 8He struck down the firstborn of Egypt,

poetryblock.poem: both people and animals.

poem.verse: 9He sent signs and wonders against you, Egypt,

poetryblock.poem: against Pharaoh and all his officials.

poem.verse: 10He struck down many nations

poetryblock.poem: and slaughtered mighty kings:

poem.verse: 11Sihon king of the Amorites,

poetryblock.poem: Og king of Bashan,
and all the kings of Canaan.

poem.verse: 12He gave their land as an inheritance,

poetryblock.poem: an inheritance to his people Israel.

poem.verse: 13Lord, your name endures for ever,

poetryblock.poem: your reputation, Lord,
through all generations.

poem.verse: 14For the Lord will vindicate his people

poetryblock.poem: and have compassion on his servants.

poem.verse: 15The idols of the nations are of silver and gold,

poetryblock.poem: made by human hands.

poem.verse: 16They have mouths but cannot speak,

poetryblock.poem: eyes, but cannot see.

poem.verse: 17They have ears but cannot hear;

poetryblock.poem: indeed, there is no breath in their mouths.

poem.verse: 18Those who make them are just like them,

poetryblock.poem: as are all who trust in them.

poem.verse: 19House of Israel, bless the Lord!

poetryblock.poem: House of Aaron, bless the Lord!

poem.verse: 20House of Levi, bless the Lord!

poetryblock.poem: You who revere the Lord, bless the Lord!

poem.verse: 21Blessed be the Lord from Zion;

poetryblock.poem: he dwells in Jerusalem.
Hallelujah!

poem.verse: 1Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good.

poetryblock.poem: His faithful love endures for ever.

poem.verse: 2Give thanks to the God of gods.

poetryblock.poem: His faithful love endures for ever.

poem.verse: 3Give thanks to the Lord of lords.

poetryblock.poem: His faithful love endures for ever.

poem.verse: 4He alone does great wonders.

poetryblock.poem: His faithful love endures for ever.

poem.verse: 5He made the heavens skilfully.

poetryblock.poem: His faithful love endures for ever.

poem.verse: 6He spread the land on the waters.

poetryblock.poem: His faithful love endures for ever.

poem.verse: 7He made the great lights:

poetryblock.poem: His faithful love endures for ever.

poem.verse: 8the sun to rule by day,

poetryblock.poem: His faithful love endures for ever.

poem.verse: 9the moon and stars to rule by night.

poetryblock.poem: His faithful love endures for ever.

poem.verse: 10He struck the firstborn of the Egyptians

poetryblock.poem: His faithful love endures for ever.

poem.verse: 11and brought Israel out from among them

poetryblock.poem: His faithful love endures for ever.

poem.verse: 12with a strong hand and outstretched arm.

poetryblock.poem: His faithful love endures for ever.

poem.verse: 13He divided the Red Sea

poetryblock.poem: His faithful love endures for ever.

poem.verse: 14and led Israel through,

poetryblock.poem: His faithful love endures for ever.

poem.verse: 15but hurled Pharaoh and his army into the Red Sea.

poetryblock.poem: His faithful love endures for ever.

poem.verse: 16He led his people in the wilderness.

poetryblock.poem: His faithful love endures for ever.

poem.verse: 17He struck down great kings

poetryblock.poem: His faithful love endures for ever.

poem.verse: 18and slaughtered famous kings –

poetryblock.poem: His faithful love endures for ever.

poem.verse: 19Sihon king of the Amorites

poetryblock.poem: His faithful love endures for ever.

poem.verse: 20and Og king of Bashan –

poetryblock.poem: His faithful love endures for ever.

poem.verse: 21and gave their land as an inheritance,

poetryblock.poem: His faithful love endures for ever.

poem.verse: 22an inheritance to Israel his servant.

poetryblock.poem: His faithful love endures for ever.

poem.verse: 23He remembered us in our humiliation

poetryblock.poem: His faithful love endures for ever.

poem.verse: 24and rescued us from our foes.

poetryblock.poem: His faithful love endures for ever.

poem.verse: 25He gives food to every creature.

poetryblock.poem: His faithful love endures for ever.

poem.verse: 26Give thanks to the God of heaven!

poetryblock.poem: His faithful love endures for ever.

poem.verse: 1By the rivers of Babylon –

poetryblock.poem: there we sat down and wept
when we remembered Zion.

poem.verse: 2There we hung up our lyres

poetryblock.poem: on the poplar trees,

poem.verse: 3for our captors there asked us for songs,

poetryblock.poem: and our tormentors, for rejoicing:
‘Sing us one of the songs of Zion.’

poem.verse: 4How can we sing the Lord’s song

poetryblock.poem: on foreign soil?

poem.verse: 5If I forget you, Jerusalem,

poetryblock.poem: may my right hand forget its skill.

poem.verse: 6May my tongue stick to the roof of my mouth

poetryblock.poem: if I do not remember you,
if I do not exalt Jerusalem as my greatest joy!

poem.verse: 7Remember, Lord, what the Edomites said

poetryblock.poem: that day at Jerusalem:
‘Destroy it! Destroy it
down to its foundations! ’

poem.verse: 8Daughter Babylon, doomed to destruction,

poetryblock.poem: happy is the one who pays you back
what you have done to us.

poem.verse: 9Happy is he who takes your little ones

poetryblock.poem: and dashes them against the rocks.

chapter.head2: Of David.

poem.verse: 1I will give you thanks with all my heart;

poetryblock.poem: I will sing your praise before the heavenly beings.

poem.verse: 2I will bow down towards your holy temple

poetryblock.poem: and give thanks to your name
for your constant love and truth.
You have exalted your name
and your promise above everything else.

poem.verse: 3On the day I called, you answered me;

poetryblock.poem: you increased strength within me.

poem.verse: 4All the kings on earth will give you thanks, Lord,

poetryblock.poem: when they hear what you have promised.

poem.verse: 5They will sing of the Lord’s ways,

poetryblock.poem: for the Lord’s glory is great.

poem.verse: 6Though the Lord is exalted,

poetryblock.poem: he takes note of the humble;
but he knows the haughty from a distance.

poem.verse: 7If I walk into the thick of danger,

poetryblock.poem: you will preserve my life
from the anger of my enemies.
You will extend your hand;
your right hand will save me.

poem.verse: 8The Lord will fulfil his purpose for me.

poetryblock.poem: Lord, your faithful love endures for ever;
do not abandon the work of your hands.

chapter.head2: For the choir director. A psalm of David.

poem.verse: 1Lord, you have searched me and known me.
2You know when I sit down and when I stand up;

poetryblock.poem: you understand my thoughts from far away.

poem.verse: 3You observe my travels and my rest;

poetryblock.poem: you are aware of all my ways.

poem.verse: 4Before a word is on my tongue,

poetryblock.poem: you know all about it, Lord.

poem.verse: 5You have encircled me;

poetryblock.poem: you have placed your hand on me.

poem.verse: 6This wondrous knowledge is beyond me.

poetryblock.poem: It is lofty; I am unable to reach it.

poem.verse: 7Where can I go to escape your Spirit?

poetryblock.poem: Where can I flee from your presence?

poem.verse: 8If I go up to heaven, you are there;

poetryblock.poem: if I make my bed in Sheol, you are there.

poem.verse: 9If I fly on the wings of the dawn

poetryblock.poem: and settle down on the western horizon,

poem.verse: 10even there your hand will lead me;

poetryblock.poem: your right hand will hold on to me.

poem.verse: 11If I say, ‘Surely the darkness will hide me,

poetryblock.poem: and the light around me will be night’ –

poem.verse: 12even the darkness is not dark to you.

poetryblock.poem: The night shines like the day;
darkness and light are alike to you.

poem.verse: 13For it was you who created my inward parts;

poetryblock.poem: you knit me together in my mother’s womb.

poem.verse: 14I will praise you

poetryblock.poem: because I have been remarkably and wondrously made.
Your works are wondrous,
and I know this very well.

poem.verse: 15My bones were not hidden from you

poetryblock.poem: when I was made in secret,
when I was formed in the depths of the earth.

poem.verse: 16Your eyes saw me when I was formless;

poetryblock.poem: all my days were written in your book and planned
before a single one of them began.

poem.verse: 17God, how precious your thoughts are to me;

poetryblock.poem: how vast their sum is!

poem.verse: 18If I counted them,

poetryblock.poem: they would outnumber the grains of sand;
when I wake up, I am still with you.

poem.verse: 19God, if only you would kill the wicked –

poetryblock.poem: you bloodthirsty men, stay away from me –

poem.verse: 20who invoke you deceitfully.

poetryblock.poem: Your enemies swear by you falsely.

poem.verse: 21Lord, don’t I hate those who hate you,

poetryblock.poem: and detest those who rebel against you?

poem.verse: 22I hate them with extreme hatred;

poetryblock.poem: I consider them my enemies.

poem.verse: 23Search me, God, and know my heart;

poetryblock.poem: test me and know my concerns.

poem.verse: 24See if there is any offensive way in me;

poetryblock.poem: lead me in the everlasting way.

chapter.head2: For the choir director. A psalm of David.

poem.verse: 1Rescue me, Lord, from evil men.

poetryblock.poem: Keep me safe from violent men

poem.verse: 2who plan evil in their hearts.

poetryblock.poem: They stir up wars all day long.

poem.verse: 3They make their tongues

poetryblock.poem: as sharp as a snake’s bite;
viper’s venom is under their lips.'Selah'

poem.verse: 4Protect me, Lord,

poetryblock.poem: from the power of the wicked.
Keep me safe from violent men
who plan to make me stumble.

poem.verse: 5The proud hide a trap with ropes for me;

poetryblock.poem: they spread a net along the path
and set snares for me.'Selah'

poem.verse: 6I say to the Lord, ‘You are my God.’

poetryblock.poem: Listen, Lord, to my cry for help.

poem.verse: 7Lord, my Lord, my strong Saviour,

poetryblock.poem: you shield my head on the day of battle.

poem.verse: 8Lord, do not grant the desires of the wicked;

poetryblock.poem: do not let them achieve their goals.
Otherwise, they will become proud.'Selah'

poem.verse: 9When those who surround me rise up,

poetryblock.poem: may the trouble their lips cause overwhelm them.

poem.verse: 10Let hot coals fall on them.

poetryblock.poem: Let them be thrown into the fire,
into the abyss, never again to rise.

poem.verse: 11Do not let a slanderer stay in the land.

poetryblock.poem: Let evil relentlessly hunt down a violent man.

poem.verse: 12I know that the Lord upholds

poetryblock.poem: the just cause of the poor,
justice for the needy.

poem.verse: 13Surely the righteous will praise your name;

poetryblock.poem: the upright will live in your presence.

chapter.head2: A psalm of David.

poem.verse: 1Lord, I call on you; hurry to help me.

poetryblock.poem: Listen to my voice when I call on you.

poem.verse: 2May my prayer be set before you as incense,

poetryblock.poem: the raising of my hands as the evening offering.

poem.verse: 3Lord, set up a guard for my mouth;

poetryblock.poem: keep watch at the door of my lips.

poem.verse: 4Do not let my heart turn to any evil thing

poetryblock.poem: or perform wicked acts with evildoers.
Do not let me feast on their delicacies.

poem.verse: 5Let the righteous one strike me –

poetryblock.poem: it is an act of faithful love;
let him rebuke me –
it is oil for my head;
let me not refuse it.
Even now my prayer is against
the evil acts of the wicked.

poem.verse: 6When their rulers will be thrown off

poetryblock.poem: the sides of a cliff,
the people will listen to my words,
for they are pleasing.

poem.verse: 7As when one ploughs and breaks up the soil,

poetryblock.poem: turning up rocks,
so our bones have been scattered
at the mouth of Sheol.

poem.verse: 8But my eyes look to you, Lord, my Lord.

poetryblock.poem: I seek refuge in you; do not let me die.

poem.verse: 9Protect me from the trap they have set for me,

poetryblock.poem: and from the snares of evildoers.

poem.verse: 10Let the wicked fall into their own nets,

poetryblock.poem: while I pass by safely.

chapter.head2: A 'Maskil' of David. When he was in the cave. A prayer.

poem.verse: 1I cry aloud to the Lord;

poetryblock.poem: I plead aloud to the Lord for mercy.

poem.verse: 2I pour out my complaint before him;

poetryblock.poem: I reveal my trouble to him.

poem.verse: 3Although my spirit is weak within me,

poetryblock.poem: you know my way.
Along this path I travel
they have hidden a trap for me.

poem.verse: 4Look to the right and see:

poetryblock.poem: no one stands up for me;
there is no refuge for me;
no one cares about me.

poem.verse: 5I cry to you, Lord;

poetryblock.poem: I say, ‘You are my shelter,
my portion in the land of the living.’

poem.verse: 6Listen to my cry,

poetryblock.poem: for I am very weak.
Rescue me from those who pursue me,
for they are too strong for me.

poem.verse: 7Free me from prison

poetryblock.poem: so that I can praise your name.
The righteous will gather around me
because you deal generously with me.

chapter.head2: A psalm of David.

poem.verse: 1Lord, hear my prayer.

poetryblock.poem: In your faithfulness listen to my plea,
and in your righteousness answer me.

poem.verse: 2Do not bring your servant into judgement,

poetryblock.poem: for no one alive is righteous in your sight.

poem.verse: 3For the enemy has pursued me,

poetryblock.poem: crushing me to the ground,
making me live in darkness
like those long dead.

poem.verse: 4My spirit is weak within me;

poetryblock.poem: my heart is overcome with dismay.

poem.verse: 5I remember the days of old;

poetryblock.poem: I meditate on all you have done;
I reflect on the work of your hands.

poem.verse: 6I spread out my hands to you;

poetryblock.poem: I am like parched land before you.'Selah'

poem.verse: 7Answer me quickly, Lord;

poetryblock.poem: my spirit fails.
Don’t hide your face from me,
or I will be like those
going down to the Pit.

poem.verse: 8Let me experience

poetryblock.poem: your faithful love in the morning,
for I trust in you.
Reveal to me the way I should go
because I appeal to you.

poem.verse: 9Rescue me from my enemies, Lord;

poetryblock.poem: I come to you for protection.

poem.verse: 10Teach me to do your will,

poetryblock.poem: for you are my God.
May your gracious Spirit
lead me on level ground.

poem.verse: 11For your name’s sake, Lord,

poetryblock.poem: let me live.
In your righteousness deliver me from trouble,

poem.verse: 12and in your faithful love destroy my enemies.

poetryblock.poem: Wipe out all those who attack me,
for I am your servant.

chapter.head2: Of David.

poem.verse: 1Blessed be the Lord, my rock

poetryblock.poem: who trains my hands for battle
and my fingers for warfare.

poem.verse: 2He is my faithful love and my fortress,

poetryblock.poem: my stronghold and my deliverer.
He is my shield, and I take refuge in him;
he subdues my people under me.

poem.verse: 3Lord, what is a human that you care for him,

poetryblock.poem: a son of man that you think of him?

poem.verse: 4A human is like a breath;

poetryblock.poem: his days are like a passing shadow.

poem.verse: 5Lord, part your heavens and come down.

poetryblock.poem: Touch the mountains, and they will smoke.

poem.verse: 6Flash your lightning and scatter the foe;

poetryblock.poem: shoot your arrows and rout them.

poem.verse: 7Reach down from on high;

poetryblock.poem: rescue me from deep water, and set me free
from the grasp of foreigners

poem.verse: 8whose mouths speak lies,

poetryblock.poem: whose right hands are deceptive.

poem.verse: 9God, I will sing a new song to you;

poetryblock.poem: I will play on a ten-stringed harp for you –

poem.verse: 10the one who gives victory to kings,

poetryblock.poem: who frees his servant David
from the deadly sword.

poem.verse: 11Set me free and rescue me

poetryblock.poem: from foreigners
whose mouths speak lies,
whose right hands are deceptive.

poem.verse: 12Then our sons will be like plants

poetryblock.poem: nurtured in their youth,
our daughters, like corner pillars
that are carved in the palace style.

poem.verse: 13Our storehouses will be full,

poetryblock.poem: supplying all kinds of produce;
our flocks will increase by thousands
and tens of thousands in our open fields.

poem.verse: 14Our cattle will be well fed.

poetryblock.poem: There will be no breach in the walls,
no going into captivity,
and no cry of lament in our public squares.

poem.verse: 15Happy are the people with such blessings.

poetryblock.poem: Happy are the people whose God is the Lord.

chapter.head2: A hymn of David.

poem.verse: 1I exalt you, my God the King,

poetryblock.poem: and bless your name for ever and ever.

poem.verse: 2I will bless you every day;

poetryblock.poem: I will praise your name for ever and ever.

poem.verse: 3The Lord is great and is highly praised;

poetryblock.poem: his greatness is unsearchable.

poem.verse: 4One generation will declare your works to the next

poetryblock.poem: and will proclaim your mighty acts.

poem.verse: 5I will speak of your splendour and glorious majesty

poetryblock.poem: and your wondrous works.

poem.verse: 6They will proclaim the power of your awe-inspiring acts,

poetryblock.poem: and I will declare your greatness.

poem.verse: 7They will give a testimony of your great goodness

poetryblock.poem: and will joyfully sing of your righteousness.

poem.verse: 8The Lord is gracious and compassionate,

poetryblock.poem: slow to anger and great in faithful love.

poem.verse: 9The Lord is good to everyone;

poetryblock.poem: his compassion rests on all he has made.

poem.verse: 10All you have made will thank you, Lord;

poetryblock.poem: the faithful will bless you.

poem.verse: 11They will speak of the glory of your kingdom

poetryblock.poem: and will declare your might,

poem.verse: 12informing all people of your mighty acts

poetryblock.poem: and of the glorious splendour of your kingdom.

poem.verse: 13Your kingdom is an everlasting kingdom;

poetryblock.poem: your rule is for all generations.
The Lord is faithful in all his words
and gracious in all his actions.

poem.verse: 14The Lord helps all who fall;

poetryblock.poem: he raises up all who are oppressed.

poem.verse: 15All eyes look to you,

poetryblock.poem: and you give them their food at the proper time.

poem.verse: 16You open your hand

poetryblock.poem: and satisfy the desire of every living thing.

poem.verse: 17The Lord is righteous in all his ways

poetryblock.poem: and faithful in all his acts.

poem.verse: 18The Lord is near all who call out to him,

poetryblock.poem: all who call out to him with integrity.

poem.verse: 19He fulfils the desires of those who fear him;

poetryblock.poem: he hears their cry for help and saves them.

poem.verse: 20The Lord guards all those who love him,

poetryblock.poem: but he destroys all the wicked.

poem.verse: 21My mouth will declare the Lord’s praise;

poetryblock.poem: let every living thing
bless his holy name for ever and ever.

poem.verse: 1Hallelujah!

poetryblock.poem: My soul, praise the Lord.

poem.verse: 2I will praise the Lord all my life;

poetryblock.poem: I will sing to my God as long as I live.

poem.verse: 3Do not trust in nobles,

poetryblock.poem: in a son of man, who cannot save.

poem.verse: 4When his breath leaves him,

poetryblock.poem: he returns to the ground;
on that day his plans die.

poem.verse: 5Happy is the one whose help is the God of Jacob,

poetryblock.poem: whose hope is in the Lord his God,

poem.verse: 6the Maker of heaven and earth,

poetryblock.poem: the sea and everything in them.
He remains faithful for ever,

poem.verse: 7executing justice for the exploited

poetryblock.poem: and giving food to the hungry.
The Lord frees prisoners.

poem.verse: 8The Lord opens the eyes of the blind.

poetryblock.poem: The Lord raises up those who are oppressed.
The Lord loves the righteous.

poem.verse: 9The Lord protects resident foreigners

poetryblock.poem: and helps the fatherless and the widow,
but he frustrates the ways of the wicked.

poem.verse: 10The Lord reigns for ever;

poetryblock.poem: Zion, your God reigns for all generations.
Hallelujah!

poem.verse: 1Hallelujah!

poetryblock.poem: How good it is to sing to our God,
for praise is pleasant and lovely.

poem.verse: 2The Lord rebuilds Jerusalem;

poetryblock.poem: he gathers Israel’s exiled people.

poem.verse: 3He heals the broken-hearted

poetryblock.poem: and bandages their wounds.

poem.verse: 4He counts the number of the stars;

poetryblock.poem: he gives names to all of them.

poem.verse: 5Our Lord is great, vast in power;

poetryblock.poem: his understanding is infinite.

poem.verse: 6The Lord helps the oppressed

poetryblock.poem: but brings the wicked to the ground.

poem.verse: 7Sing to the Lord with thanksgiving;

poetryblock.poem: play the lyre to our God,

poem.verse: 8who covers the sky with clouds,

poetryblock.poem: prepares rain for the earth,
and causes grass to grow on the hills.

poem.verse: 9He provides the animals with their food,

poetryblock.poem: and the young ravens what they cry for.

poem.verse: 10He is not impressed by the strength of a horse;

poetryblock.poem: he does not value the power of a warrior.

poem.verse: 11The Lord values those who fear him,

poetryblock.poem: those who put their hope in his faithful love.

poem.verse: 12Exalt the Lord, Jerusalem;

poetryblock.poem: praise your God, Zion!

poem.verse: 13For he strengthens the bars of your city gates

poetryblock.poem: and blesses your children within you.

poem.verse: 14He endows your territory with prosperity;

poetryblock.poem: he satisfies you with the finest wheat.

poem.verse: 15He sends his command throughout the earth;

poetryblock.poem: his word runs swiftly.

poem.verse: 16He spreads snow like wool;

poetryblock.poem: he scatters frost like ashes;

poem.verse: 17he throws his hailstones like crumbs.

poetryblock.poem: Who can withstand his cold?

poem.verse: 18He sends his word and melts them;

poetryblock.poem: he unleashes his winds, and the water flows.

poem.verse: 19He declares his word to Jacob,

poetryblock.poem: his statutes and judgements to Israel.

poem.verse: 20He has not done this for every nation;

poetryblock.poem: they do not know his judgements.
Hallelujah!

poem.verse: 1Hallelujah!

poetryblock.poem: Praise the Lord from the heavens;
praise him in the heights.

poem.verse: 2Praise him, all his angels;

poetryblock.poem: praise him, all his heavenly armies.

poem.verse: 3Praise him, sun and moon;

poetryblock.poem: praise him, all you shining stars.

poem.verse: 4Praise him, highest heavens,

poetryblock.poem: and you waters above the heavens.

poem.verse: 5Let them praise the name of the Lord,

poetryblock.poem: for he commanded, and they were created.

poem.verse: 6He set them in position for ever and ever;

poetryblock.poem: he gave an order that will never pass away.

poem.verse: 7Praise the Lord from the earth,

poetryblock.poem: all sea monsters and ocean depths,

poem.verse: 8lightning and hail, snow and cloud,

poetryblock.poem: stormy wind that executes his command,

poem.verse: 9mountains and all hills,

poetryblock.poem: fruit trees and all cedars,

poem.verse: 10wild animals and all cattle,

poetryblock.poem: creatures that crawl and flying birds,

poem.verse: 11kings of the earth and all peoples,

poetryblock.poem: princes and all judges of the earth,

poem.verse: 12young men as well as young women,

poetryblock.poem: old and young together.

poem.verse: 13Let them praise the name of the Lord,

poetryblock.poem: for his name alone is exalted.
His majesty covers heaven and earth.

poem.verse: 14He has raised up a horn for his people,

poetryblock.poem: resulting in praise to all his faithful ones,
to the Israelites, the people close to him.
Hallelujah!

poem.verse: 1Hallelujah!

poetryblock.poem: Sing to the Lord a new song,
his praise in the assembly of the faithful.

poem.verse: 2Let Israel celebrate its Maker;

poetryblock.poem: let the children of Zion rejoice in their King.

poem.verse: 3Let them praise his name with dancing

poetryblock.poem: and make music to him with tambourine and lyre.

poem.verse: 4For the Lord takes pleasure in his people;

poetryblock.poem: he adorns the humble with salvation.

poem.verse: 5Let the faithful celebrate in triumphal glory;

poetryblock.poem: let them shout for joy on their beds.

poem.verse: 6Let the exaltation of God be in their mouths

poetryblock.poem: and a double-edged sword in their hands,

poem.verse: 7inflicting vengeance on the nations

poetryblock.poem: and punishment on the peoples,

poem.verse: 8binding their kings with chains

poetryblock.poem: and their dignitaries with iron shackles,

poem.verse: 9carrying out the judgement decreed against them.

poetryblock.poem: This honour is for all his faithful people.
Hallelujah!

poem.verse: 1Hallelujah!

poetryblock.poem: Praise God in his sanctuary.
Praise him in his mighty expanse.

poem.verse: 2Praise him for his powerful acts;

poetryblock.poem: praise him for his abundant greatness.

poem.verse: 3Praise him with the blast of a ram’s horn;

poetryblock.poem: praise him with harp and lyre.

poem.verse: 4Praise him with tambourine and dance;

poetryblock.poem: praise him with strings and flute.

poem.verse: 5Praise him with resounding cymbals;

poetryblock.poem: praise him with clashing cymbals.

poem.verse: 6Let everything that breathes praise the Lord.

poetryblock.poem: Hallelujah!
